4010  details::_Task_impl_base::_AsyncInit<_NormalizedContinuationReturnType, _ContinuationReturnType>(this->_M_pTask,
4011  ref new details::_IAsyncActionWithProgressToAsyncOperationConverter<_ProgressType>(
4012  _LogWorkItemAndInvokeUserLambda(_M_function, std::move(_ResultTask))));
4013  }
4014 #endif /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
4015  };
4016 
4017  /// <summary>
4018  /// Initializes a task using a lambda, function pointer or function object.
4019  /// </summary>
4020  template<typename _InternalReturnType, typename _Function>
4021  void _TaskInitWithFunctor(const _Function& _Func)
4022  {
4023  typedef typename details::_InitFunctorTypeTraits<_InternalReturnType, decltype(_Func())> _Async_type_traits;
4024 
4025  _M_Impl->_M_fFromAsync = _Async_type_traits::_IsAsyncTask;
4026  _M_Impl->_M_fUnwrappedTask = _Async_type_traits::_IsUnwrappedTaskOrAsync;
4027  _M_Impl->_M_taskEventLogger._LogScheduleTask(false);
4028  _M_Impl->_ScheduleTask(new _InitialTaskHandle<_InternalReturnType, _Function, typename _Async_type_traits::_AsyncKind>(_GetImpl(), _Func), details::_NoInline);
4029  }
4030 
4031  /// <summary>
4032  /// Initializes a task using a task completion event.
4033  /// </summary>
4034  void _TaskInitNoFunctor(task_completion_event<_ReturnType>& _Event)
4035  {
4036  _Event._RegisterTask(_M_Impl);
4037  }
4038 
4039 #if defined (__cplusplus_winrt)
4040  /// <summary>
4041  /// Initializes a task using an asynchronous operation IAsyncOperation<T>^
4042  /// </summary>
4043  void _TaskInitAsyncOp(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation<typename details::_ValueTypeOrRefType<_ReturnType>::_Value>^ _AsyncOp)
4044  {
4045  _M_Impl->_M_fFromAsync = true;
4046 
4047  // Mark this task as started here since we can set the state in the constructor without acquiring a lock. Once _AsyncInit
4048  // returns a completion could execute concurrently and the task must be fully initialized before that happens.
4049  _M_Impl->_M_TaskState = details::_Task_impl_base::_Started;
4050  // Pass the shared pointer into _AsyncInit for storage in the Async Callback.
4051  details::_Task_impl_base::_AsyncInit<_ReturnType, _ReturnType>(_M_Impl, _AsyncOp);
4052  }
4053 
4054  /// <summary>
4055  /// Initializes a task using an asynchronous operation IAsyncOperation<T>^
4056  /// </summary>
4057  void _TaskInitNoFunctor(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation<typename details::_ValueTypeOrRefType<_ReturnType>::_Value>^ _AsyncOp)
4058  {
4059  _TaskInitAsyncOp(_AsyncOp);
4060  }
4061 
4062  /// <summary>
4063  /// Initializes a task using an asynchronous operation with progress IAsyncOperationWithProgress<T, P>^
4064  /// </summary>
4065  template<typename _Progress>
4066  void _TaskInitNoFunctor(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperationWithProgress<typename details::_ValueTypeOrRefType<_ReturnType>::_Value, _Progress>^ _AsyncOp)
4067  {
4068  _TaskInitAsyncOp(ref new details::_IAsyncOperationWithProgressToAsyncOperationConverter<typename details::_ValueTypeOrRefType<_ReturnType>::_Value, _Progress>(_AsyncOp));
4069  }
4070 #endif /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
4071 
4072  /// <summary>
4073  /// Initializes a task using a callable object.
4074  /// </summary>
4075  template<typename _Function>
4076  void _TaskInitMaybeFunctor(_Function & _Func, std::true_type)
4077  {
4078  _TaskInitWithFunctor<_ReturnType, _Function>(_Func);
4079  }
4080 
4081  /// <summary>
4082  /// Initializes a task using a non-callable object.
4083  /// </summary>
4084  template<typename _Ty>
4085  void _TaskInitMaybeFunctor(_Ty & _Param, std::false_type)
4086  {
4087  _TaskInitNoFunctor(_Param);
4088  }
4089 
4090  template<typename _InternalReturnType, typename _Function>
4091  auto _ThenImpl(const _Function& _Func, const task_options& _TaskOptions) const -> typename details::_ContinuationTypeTraits<_Function, _InternalReturnType>::_TaskOfType
4092  {
4093  if (!_M_Impl)
4094  {
4095  throw invalid_operation("then() cannot be called on a default constructed task.");
4096  }
4097 
4098  details::_CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState = _TaskOptions.has_cancellation_token() ? _TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue() : nullptr;
4099  auto _Scheduler = _TaskOptions.has_scheduler() ? _TaskOptions.get_scheduler() : _GetImpl()->_GetScheduler();
4100  auto _CreationStack = details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._M_hasPresetCreationCallstack ? details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._M_presetCreationCallstack : details::_TaskCreationCallstack();
4101  return _ThenImpl<_InternalReturnType, _Function>(_Func, _PTokenState, _TaskOptions.get_continuation_context(), _Scheduler, _CreationStack);
4102  }
4103 
4104  /// <summary>
4105  /// The one and only implementation of then for void and non-void tasks.
4106  /// </summary>
4107  template<typename _InternalReturnType, typename _Function>
4108  auto _ThenImpl(const _Function& _Func, details::_CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState, const task_continuation_context& _ContinuationContext, scheduler_ptr _Scheduler, details::_TaskCreationCallstack _CreationStack,
4109  details::_TaskInliningMode_t _InliningMode = details::_NoInline) const -> typename details::_ContinuationTypeTraits<_Function, _InternalReturnType>::_TaskOfType
4110  {
4111  if (!_M_Impl)
4112  {
4113  throw invalid_operation("then() cannot be called on a default constructed task.");
4114  }
4115 
4116  typedef details::_FunctionTypeTraits<_Function, _InternalReturnType> _Function_type_traits;
4117  typedef details::_TaskTypeTraits<typename _Function_type_traits::_FuncRetType> _Async_type_traits;
4118  typedef typename _Async_type_traits::_TaskRetType _TaskType;
4119 
4120  //
4121  // A **nullptr** token state indicates that it was not provided by the user. In this case, we inherit the antecedent's token UNLESS this is a
4122  // an exception handling continuation. In that case, we break the chain with a _None. That continuation is never canceled unless the user
4123  // explicitly passes the same token.
4124  //
4125  if (_PTokenState == nullptr)
4126  {
4127  if (_Function_type_traits::_Takes_task::value)
4128  {
4129  _PTokenState = details::_CancellationTokenState::_None();
4130  }
4131  else
4132  {
4133  _PTokenState = _GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState;
4134  }
4135  }
4136 
4137  task<_TaskType> _ContinuationTask;
4138  _ContinuationTask._CreateImpl(_PTokenState, _Scheduler);
4139 
4140  _ContinuationTask._GetImpl()->_M_fFromAsync = (_GetImpl()->_M_fFromAsync || _Async_type_traits::_IsAsyncTask);
4141  _ContinuationTask._GetImpl()->_M_fUnwrappedTask = _Async_type_traits::_IsUnwrappedTaskOrAsync;
4142  _ContinuationTask._SetTaskCreationCallstack(_CreationStack);
4143 
4144  _GetImpl()->_ScheduleContinuation(new _ContinuationTaskHandle<_InternalReturnType, _TaskType, _Function, typename _Function_type_traits::_Takes_task, typename _Async_type_traits::_AsyncKind>(
4145  _GetImpl(), _ContinuationTask._GetImpl(), _Func, _ContinuationContext, _InliningMode));
4146 
4147  return _ContinuationTask;
4148  }
4149 
4150  // The underlying implementation for this task
4151  typename details::_Task_ptr<_ReturnType>::_Type _M_Impl;
4152 };
4153 
4154 /// <summary>
4155 /// The Parallel Patterns Library (PPL) <c>task</c> class. A <c>task</c> object represents work that can be executed asynchronously,
4156 /// and concurrently with other tasks and parallel work produced by parallel algorithms in the Concurrency Runtime. It produces
4157 /// a result of type <typeparamref name="_ResultType"/> on successful completion. Tasks of type <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c> produce no result.
4158 /// A task can be waited upon and canceled independently of other tasks. It can also be composed with other tasks using
4159 /// continuations(<c>then</c>), and join(<c>when_all</c>) and choice(<c>when_any</c>) patterns.
4160 /// </summary>
4161 /// <remarks>
4162 /// For more information, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.
4163 /// </remarks>
4164 /**/
4165 template<>
4166 class task<void>
4167 {
4168 public:
4169  /// <summary>
4170  /// The type of the result an object of this class produces.
4171  /// </summary>
4172  /**/
4173  typedef void result_type;
4174 
4175  /// <summary>
4176  /// Constructs a <c>task</c> object.
4177  /// </summary>
4178  /// <remarks>
4179  /// The default constructor for a <c>task</c> is only present in order to allow tasks to be used within containers.
4180  /// A default constructed task cannot be used until you assign a valid task to it. Methods such as <c>get</c>, <c>wait</c> or <c>then</c>
4181  /// will throw an <see cref="invalid_argument Class">invalid_argument</see> exception when called on a default constructed task.
4182  /// <para>A task that is created from a <c>task_completion_event</c> will complete (and have its continuations scheduled) when the task
4183  /// completion event is set.</para>
4184  /// <para>The version of the constructor that takes a cancellation token creates a task that can be canceled using the
4185  /// <c>cancellation_token_source</c> the token was obtained from. Tasks created without a cancellation token are not cancelable.</para>
4186  /// <para>Tasks created from a <c>Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo</c> interface or a lambda that returns an <c>IAsyncInfo</c> interface
4187  /// reach their terminal state when the enclosed Windows Runtime asynchronous operation or action completes. Similarly, tasks created
4188  /// from a lamda that returns a <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c> reach their terminal state when the inner task reaches its terminal state,
4189  /// and not when the lamda returns.</para>
4190  /// <para><c>task</c> behaves like a smart pointer and is safe to pass around by value. It can be accessed by multiple threads
4191  /// without the need for locks.</para>
4192  /// <para>The constructor overloads that take a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface or a lambda returning such an interface, are only available
4193  /// to Windows Store apps.</para>
4194  /// <para>For more information, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.</para>
4195  /// </remarks>
4196  /**/
4197  task() : _M_unitTask()
4198  {
4199  // The default constructor should create a task with a nullptr impl. This is a signal that the
4200  // task is not usable and should throw if any wait(), get() or then() APIs are used.
4201  }
4202 
4203  /// <summary>
4204  /// Constructs a <c>task</c> object.
4205  /// </summary>
4206  /// <typeparam name="_Ty">
4207  /// The type of the parameter from which the task is to be constructed.
4208  /// </typeparam>
4209  /// <param name="_Param">
4210  /// The parameter from which the task is to be constructed. This could be a lambda, a function object, a <c>task_completion_event&lt;result_type&gt;</c>
4211  /// object, or a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo if you are using tasks in your Windows Store app. The lambda or function
4212  /// object should be a type equivalent to <c>std::function&lt;X(void)&gt;</c>, where X can be a variable of type <c>result_type</c>,
4213  /// <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c>, or a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo in Windows Store apps.
4214  /// </param>
4215  /// <remarks>
4216  /// The default constructor for a <c>task</c> is only present in order to allow tasks to be used within containers.
4217  /// A default constructed task cannot be used until you assign a valid task to it. Methods such as <c>get</c>, <c>wait</c> or <c>then</c>
4218  /// will throw an <see cref="invalid_argument Class">invalid_argument</see> exception when called on a default constructed task.
4219  /// <para>A task that is created from a <c>task_completion_event</c> will complete (and have its continuations scheduled) when the task
4220  /// completion event is set.</para>
4221  /// <para>The version of the constructor that takes a cancellation token creates a task that can be canceled using the
4222  /// <c>cancellation_token_source</c> the token was obtained from. Tasks created without a cancellation token are not cancelable.</para>
4223  /// <para>Tasks created from a <c>Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo</c> interface or a lambda that returns an <c>IAsyncInfo</c> interface
4224  /// reach their terminal state when the enclosed Windows Runtime asynchronous operation or action completes. Similarly, tasks created
4225  /// from a lamda that returns a <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c> reach their terminal state when the inner task reaches its terminal state,
4226  /// and not when the lamda returns.</para>
4227  /// <para><c>task</c> behaves like a smart pointer and is safe to pass around by value. It can be accessed by multiple threads
4228  /// without the need for locks.</para>
4229  /// <para>The constructor overloads that take a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface or a lambda returning such an interface, are only available
4230  /// to Windows Store apps.</para>
4231  /// <para>For more information, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.</para>
4232  /// </remarks>
4233  /**/
4234  template<typename _Ty>
4235  __declspec(noinline) // Ask for no inlining so that the _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK gives us the expected result
4236  explicit task(_Ty _Param, const task_options& _TaskOptions = task_options())
4237  {
4238  details::_ValidateTaskConstructorArgs<void,_Ty>(_Param);
4239 
4240  _M_unitTask._CreateImpl(_TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue(), _TaskOptions.get_scheduler());
4241  // Do not move the next line out of this function. It is important that _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK() evaluate to the the call site of the task constructor.
4242  _M_unitTask._SetTaskCreationCallstack(details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._M_hasPresetCreationCallstack ? details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._M_presetCreationCallstack : _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK());
4243 
4244  _TaskInitMaybeFunctor(_Param, details::_IsCallable(_Param,0));
4245  }
4246 
4247  /// <summary>
4248  /// Constructs a <c>task</c> object.
4249  /// </summary>
4250  /// <param name="_Other">
4251  /// The source <c>task</c> object.
4252  /// </param>
4253  /// <remarks>
4254  /// The default constructor for a <c>task</c> is only present in order to allow tasks to be used within containers.
4255  /// A default constructed task cannot be used until you assign a valid task to it. Methods such as <c>get</c>, <c>wait</c> or <c>then</c>
4256  /// will throw an <see cref="invalid_argument Class">invalid_argument</see> exception when called on a default constructed task.
4257  /// <para>A task that is created from a <c>task_completion_event</c> will complete (and have its continuations scheduled) when the task
4258  /// completion event is set.</para>
4259  /// <para>The version of the constructor that takes a cancellation token creates a task that can be canceled using the
4260  /// <c>cancellation_token_source</c> the token was obtained from. Tasks created without a cancellation token are not cancelable.</para>
4261  /// <para>Tasks created from a <c>Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo</c> interface or a lambda that returns an <c>IAsyncInfo</c> interface
4262  /// reach their terminal state when the enclosed Windows Runtime asynchronous operation or action completes. Similarly, tasks created
4263  /// from a lamda that returns a <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c> reach their terminal state when the inner task reaches its terminal state,
4264  /// and not when the lamda returns.</para>
4265  /// <para><c>task</c> behaves like a smart pointer and is safe to pass around by value. It can be accessed by multiple threads
4266  /// without the need for locks.</para>
4267  /// <para>The constructor overloads that take a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface or a lambda returning such an interface, are only available
4268  /// to Windows Store apps.</para>
4269  /// <para>For more information, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.</para>
4270  /// </remarks>
4271  /**/
4272  task(const task& _Other): _M_unitTask(_Other._M_unitTask){}
4273 
4274  /// <summary>
4275  /// Constructs a <c>task</c> object.
4276  /// </summary>
4277  /// <param name="_Other">
4278  /// The source <c>task</c> object.
4279  /// </param>
4280  /// <remarks>
4281  /// The default constructor for a <c>task</c> is only present in order to allow tasks to be used within containers.
4282  /// A default constructed task cannot be used until you assign a valid task to it. Methods such as <c>get</c>, <c>wait</c> or <c>then</c>
4283  /// will throw an <see cref="invalid_argument Class">invalid_argument</see> exception when called on a default constructed task.
4284  /// <para>A task that is created from a <c>task_completion_event</c> will complete (and have its continuations scheduled) when the task
4285  /// completion event is set.</para>
4286  /// <para>The version of the constructor that takes a cancellation token creates a task that can be canceled using the
4287  /// <c>cancellation_token_source</c> the token was obtained from. Tasks created without a cancellation token are not cancelable.</para>
4288  /// <para>Tasks created from a <c>Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo</c> interface or a lambda that returns an <c>IAsyncInfo</c> interface
4289  /// reach their terminal state when the enclosed Windows Runtime asynchronous operation or action completes. Similarly, tasks created
4290  /// from a lamda that returns a <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c> reach their terminal state when the inner task reaches its terminal state,
4291  /// and not when the lamda returns.</para>
4292  /// <para><c>task</c> behaves like a smart pointer and is safe to pass around by value. It can be accessed by multiple threads
4293  /// without the need for locks.</para>
4294  /// <para>The constructor overloads that take a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface or a lambda returning such an interface, are only available
4295  /// to Windows Store apps.</para>
4296  /// <para>For more information, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.</para>
4297  /// </remarks>
4298  /**/
4299  task(task&& _Other) : _M_unitTask(std::move(_Other._M_unitTask)) {}
4300 
4301  /// <summary>
4302  /// Replaces the contents of one <c>task</c> object with another.
4303  /// </summary>
4304  /// <param name="_Other">
4305  /// The source <c>task</c> object.
4306  /// </param>
4307  /// <remarks>
4308  /// As <c>task</c> behaves like a smart pointer, after a copy assignment, this <c>task</c> objects represents the same
4309  /// actual task as <paramref name="_Other"/> does.
4310  /// </remarks>
4311  /**/
4312  task& operator=(const task& _Other)
4313  {
4314  if (this != &_Other)
4315  {
4316  _M_unitTask = _Other._M_unitTask;
4317  }
4318  return *this;
4319  }
4320 
4321  /// <summary>
4322  /// Replaces the contents of one <c>task</c> object with another.
4323  /// </summary>
4324  /// <param name="_Other">
4325  /// The source <c>task</c> object.
4326  /// </param>
4327  /// <remarks>
4328  /// As <c>task</c> behaves like a smart pointer, after a copy assignment, this <c>task</c> objects represents the same
4329  /// actual task as <paramref name="_Other"/> does.
4330  /// </remarks>
4331  /**/
4332  task& operator=(task&& _Other)
4333  {
4334  if (this != &_Other)
4335  {
4336  _M_unitTask = std::move(_Other._M_unitTask);
4337  }
4338  return *this;
4339  }
4340 
4341  /// <summary>
4342  /// Adds a continuation task to this task.
4343  /// </summary>
4344  /// <typeparam name="_Function">
4345  /// The type of the function object that will be invoked by this task.
4346  /// </typeparam>
4347  /// <param name="_Func">
4348  /// The continuation function to execute when this task completes. This continuation function must take as input
4349  /// a variable of either <c>result_type</c> or <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c>, where <c>result_type</c> is the type
4350  /// of the result this task produces.
4351  /// </param>
4352  /// <param name="_CancellationToken">
4353  /// The cancellation token to associate with the continuation task. A continuation task that is created without a cancellation token will inherit
4354  /// the token of its antecedent task.
4355  /// </param>
4356  /// <returns>
4357  /// The newly created continuation task. The result type of the returned task is determined by what <paramref name="_Func"/> returns.
4358  /// </returns>
4359  /// <remarks>
4360  /// The overloads of <c>then</c> that take a lambda or functor that returns a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface, are only available
4361  /// to Windows Store apps.
4362  /// <para>For more information on how to use task continuations to compose asynchronous work, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.</para>
4363  /// </remarks>
4364  /**/
4365  template<typename _Function>
4366  __declspec(noinline) // Ask for no inlining so that the _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK gives us the expected result
4367  auto then(const _Function& _Func, task_options _TaskOptions = task_options()) const -> typename details::_ContinuationTypeTraits<_Function, void>::_TaskOfType
4368  {
4369  details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._set_creation_callstack(_CAPTURE_CALLSTACK());
4370  return _M_unitTask._ThenImpl<void, _Function>(_Func, _TaskOptions);
4371  }
4372 
4373  /// <summary>
4374  /// Adds a continuation task to this task.
4375  /// </summary>
4376  /// <typeparam name="_Function">
4377  /// The type of the function object that will be invoked by this task.
4378  /// </typeparam>
4379  /// <param name="_Func">
4380  /// The continuation function to execute when this task completes. This continuation function must take as input
4381  /// a variable of either <c>result_type</c> or <c>task&lt;result_type&gt;</c>, where <c>result_type</c> is the type
4382  /// of the result this task produces.
4383  /// </param>
4384  /// <param name="_CancellationToken">
4385  /// The cancellation token to associate with the continuation task. A continuation task that is created without a cancellation token will inherit
4386  /// the token of its antecedent task.
4387  /// </param>
4388  /// <param name="_ContinuationContext">
4389  /// A variable that specifies where the continuation should execute. This variable is only useful when used in a Windows Store
4390  /// style app. For more information, see <see cref="task_continuation_context Class">task_continuation_context</see>
4391  /// </param>
4392  /// <returns>
4393  /// The newly created continuation task. The result type of the returned task is determined by what <paramref name="_Func"/> returns.
4394  /// </returns>
4395  /// <remarks>
4396  /// The overloads of <c>then</c> that take a lambda or functor that returns a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface, are only available
4397  /// to Windows Store apps.
4398  /// <para>For more information on how to use task continuations to compose asynchronous work, see <see cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>.</para>
4399  /// </remarks>
4400  /**/
4401  template<typename _Function>
4402  __declspec(noinline) // Ask for no inlining so that the _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK gives us the expected result
4403  auto then(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token _CancellationToken, task_continuation_context _ContinuationContext) const -> typename details::_ContinuationTypeTraits<_Function, void>::_TaskOfType
4404  {
4405  task_options _TaskOptions(_CancellationToken, _ContinuationContext);
4406  details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._set_creation_callstack(_CAPTURE_CALLSTACK());
4407  return _M_unitTask._ThenImpl<void, _Function>(_Func, _TaskOptions);
4408  }
4409 
4410  /// <summary>
4411  /// Waits for this task to reach a terminal state. It is possible for <c>wait</c> to execute the task inline, if all of the tasks
4412  /// dependencies are satisfied, and it has not already been picked up for execution by a background worker.
4413  /// </summary>
4414  /// <returns>
4415  /// A <c>task_status</c> value which could be either <c>completed</c> or <c>canceled</c>. If the task encountered an exception
4416  /// during execution, or an exception was propagated to it from an antecedent task, <c>wait</c> will throw that exception.
4417  /// </returns>
4418  /**/
4419  task_status wait() const
4420  {
4421  return _M_unitTask.wait();
4422  }
4423 
4424  /// <summary>
4425  /// Returns the result this task produced. If the task is not in a terminal state, a call to <c>get</c> will wait for the task to
4426  /// finish. This method does not return a value when called on a task with a <c>result_type</c> of <c>void</c>.
4427  /// </summary>
4428  /// <remarks>
4429  /// If the task is canceled, a call to <c>get</c> will throw a <see cref="task_canceled Class">task_canceled</see> exception. If the task
4430  /// encountered an different exception or an exception was propagated to it from an antecedent task, a call to <c>get</c> will throw that exception.
4431  /// </remarks>
4432  /**/
4433  void get() const
4434  {
4435  _M_unitTask.get();
4436  }
4437 
4438  /// <summary>
4439  /// Determines if the task is completed.
4440  /// </summary>
4441  /// <returns>
4442  /// True if the task has completed, false otherwise.
4443  /// </returns>
4444  /// <remarks>
4445  /// The function returns true if the task is completed or canceled (with or without user exception).
4446  /// </remarks>
4447  bool is_done() const
4448  {
4449  return _M_unitTask.is_done();
4450  }
4451 
4452  /// <summary>
4453  /// Returns the scheduler for this task
4454  /// </summary>
4455  /// <returns>
4456  /// A pointer to the scheduler
4457  /// </returns>
4458  scheduler_ptr scheduler() const
4459  {
4460  return _M_unitTask.scheduler();
4461  }
4462 
4463  /// <summary>
4464  /// Determines whether the task unwraps a Windows Runtime <c>IAsyncInfo</c> interface or is descended from such a task.
4465  /// </summary>
4466  /// <returns>
4467  /// <c>true</c> if the task unwraps an <c>IAsyncInfo</c> interface or is descended from such a task, <c>false</c> otherwise.
4468  /// </returns>
4469  /**/
4470  bool is_apartment_aware() const
4471  {
4472  return _M_unitTask.is_apartment_aware();
4473  }
4474 
4475  /// <summary>
4476  /// Determines whether two <c>task</c> objects represent the same internal task.
4477  /// </summary>
4478  /// <returns>
4479  /// <c>true</c> if the objects refer to the same underlying task, and <c>false</c> otherwise.
4480  /// </returns>
4481  /**/
4482  bool operator==(const task<void>& _Rhs) const
4483  {
4484  return (_M_unitTask == _Rhs._M_unitTask);
4485  }
4486 
4487  /// <summary>
4488  /// Determines whether two <c>task</c> objects represent different internal tasks.
4489  /// </summary>
4490  /// <returns>
4491  /// <c>true</c> if the objects refer to different underlying tasks, and <c>false</c> otherwise.
4492  /// </returns>
4493  /**/
4494  bool operator!=(const task<void>& _Rhs) const
4495  {
4496  return !operator==(_Rhs);
4497  }
4498 
4499  /// <summary>
4500  /// Create an underlying task implementation.
4501  /// </summary>
4502  void _CreateImpl(details::_CancellationTokenState * _Ct, scheduler_ptr _Scheduler)
4503  {
4504  _M_unitTask._CreateImpl(_Ct, _Scheduler);
4505  }
4506 
4507  /// <summary>
4508  /// Return the underlying implementation for this task.
4509  /// </summary>
4510  const details::_Task_ptr<details::_Unit_type>::_Type & _GetImpl() const
4511  {
4512  return _M_unitTask._M_Impl;
4513  }
4514 
4515  /// <summary>
4516  /// Set the implementation of the task to be the supplied implementaion.
4517  /// </summary>
4518  void _SetImpl(const details::_Task_ptr<details::_Unit_type>::_Type & _Impl)
4519  {
4520  _M_unitTask._SetImpl(_Impl);
4521  }
4522 
4523  /// <summary>
4524  /// Set the implementation of the task to be the supplied implementaion using a move instead of a copy.
4525  /// </summary>
4526  void _SetImpl(details::_Task_ptr<details::_Unit_type>::_Type && _Impl)
4527  {
4528  _M_unitTask._SetImpl(std::move(_Impl));
4529  }
4530 
4531  /// <summary>
4532  /// Sets a property determining whether the task is apartment aware.
4533  /// </summary>
4534  void _SetAsync(bool _Async = true)
4535  {
4536  _M_unitTask._SetAsync(_Async);
4537  }
4538 
4539  /// <summary>
4540  /// Sets a field in the task impl to the return callstack for calls to the task constructors and the then method.
4541  /// </summary>
4542  void _SetTaskCreationCallstack(const details::_TaskCreationCallstack &_callstack)
4543  {
4544  _M_unitTask._SetTaskCreationCallstack(_callstack);
4545  }
4546 
4547  /// <summary>
4548  /// An internal version of then that takes additional flags and executes the continuation inline. Used for runtime internal continuations only.
4549  /// </summary>
4550  template<typename _Function>
4551  auto _Then(const _Function& _Func, details::_CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState,
4552  details::_TaskInliningMode_t _InliningMode = details::_ForceInline) const -> typename details::_ContinuationTypeTraits<_Function, void>::_TaskOfType
4553  {
4554  // inherit from antecedent
4555  auto _Scheduler = _GetImpl()->_GetScheduler();
4556 
4557  return _M_unitTask._ThenImpl<void, _Function>(_Func, _PTokenState, task_continuation_context::use_default(), _Scheduler, _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK(), _InliningMode);
4558  }
4559 
4560 private:
4561  template <typename T> friend class task;
4562  template <typename T> friend class task_completion_event;
4563 
4564  /// <summary>
4565  /// Initializes a task using a task completion event.
4566  /// </summary>
4567  void _TaskInitNoFunctor(task_completion_event<void>& _Event)
4568  {
4569  _M_unitTask._TaskInitNoFunctor(_Event._M_unitEvent);
4570  }
4571 
4572 #if defined (__cplusplus_winrt)
4573  /// <summary>
4574  /// Initializes a task using an asynchronous action IAsyncAction^
4575  /// </summary>
4576  void _TaskInitNoFunctor(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncAction^ _AsyncAction)
4577  {
4578  _M_unitTask._TaskInitAsyncOp(ref new details::_IAsyncActionToAsyncOperationConverter(_AsyncAction));
4579  }
4580 
4581  /// <summary>
4582  /// Initializes a task using an asynchronous action with progress IAsyncActionWithProgress<_P>^
4583  /// </summary>
4584  template<typename _P>
4585  void _TaskInitNoFunctor(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncActionWithProgress<_P>^ _AsyncActionWithProgress)
4586  {
4587  _M_unitTask._TaskInitAsyncOp(ref new details::_IAsyncActionWithProgressToAsyncOperationConverter<_P>(_AsyncActionWithProgress));
4588  }
4589 #endif /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
4590 
4591  /// <summary>
4592  /// Initializes a task using a callable object.
4593  /// </summary>
4594  template<typename _Function>
4595  void _TaskInitMaybeFunctor(_Function & _Func, std::true_type)
4596  {
4597  _M_unitTask._TaskInitWithFunctor<void, _Function>(_Func);
4598  }
4599 
4600  /// <summary>
4601  /// Initializes a task using a non-callable object.
4602  /// </summary>
4603  template<typename _T>
4604  void _TaskInitMaybeFunctor(_T & _Param, std::false_type)
4605  {
4606  _TaskInitNoFunctor(_Param);
4607  }
4608 
4609  // The void task contains a task of a dummy type so common code can be used for tasks with void and non-void results.
4610  task<details::_Unit_type> _M_unitTask;
4611 };
4612 
4613 namespace details
4614 {
4615  /// <summary>
4616  /// The following type traits are used for the create_task function.
4617  /// </summary>
4618 
4619 #if defined (__cplusplus_winrt)
4620  // Unwrap functions for asyncOperations
4621  template<typename _Ty>
4622  _Ty _GetUnwrappedType(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation<_Ty>^);
4623 
4624  void _GetUnwrappedType(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncAction^);
4625 
4626  template<typename _Ty, typename _Progress>
4627  _Ty _GetUnwrappedType(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperationWithProgress<_Ty, _Progress>^);
4628 
4629  template<typename _Progress>
4630  void _GetUnwrappedType(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncActionWithProgress<_Progress>^);
4631 #endif /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
4632 
4633  // Unwrap task<T>
4634  template<typename _Ty>
4635  _Ty _GetUnwrappedType(task<_Ty>);
4636 
4637  // Unwrap all supportted types
4638  template<typename _Ty>
4639  auto _GetUnwrappedReturnType(_Ty _Arg, int) -> decltype(_GetUnwrappedType(_Arg));
4640  // fallback
4641  template<typename _Ty>
4642  _Ty _GetUnwrappedReturnType(_Ty, ...);
4643 
4644  /// <summary>
4645  /// <c>_GetTaskType</c> functions will retrieve task type <c>T</c> in <c>task[T](Arg)</c>,
4646  /// for given constructor argument <c>Arg</c> and its property "callable".
4647  /// It will automatically unwrap argument to get the final return type if necessary.
4648  /// </summary>
4649 
4650  // Non-Callable
4651  template<typename _Ty>
4652  _Ty _GetTaskType(task_completion_event<_Ty>, std::false_type);
4653 
4654  // Non-Callable
4655  template<typename _Ty>
4656  auto _GetTaskType(_Ty _NonFunc, std::false_type) -> decltype(_GetUnwrappedType(_NonFunc));
4657 
4658  // Callable
4659  template<typename _Ty>
4660  auto _GetTaskType(_Ty _Func, std::true_type) -> decltype(_GetUnwrappedReturnType(_Func(), 0));
4661 
4662  // Special callable returns void
4663  void _GetTaskType(std::function<void()>, std::true_type);
4664  struct _BadArgType{};
4665 
4666  template<typename _Ty>
4667  auto _FilterValidTaskType(_Ty _Param, int) -> decltype(_GetTaskType(_Param, _IsCallable(_Param, 0)));
4668 
4669  template<typename _Ty>
4670  _BadArgType _FilterValidTaskType(_Ty _Param, ...);
4671 
4672  template<typename _Ty>
4673  struct _TaskTypeFromParam
4674  {
4675  typedef decltype(_FilterValidTaskType(stdx::declval<_Ty>(), 0)) _Type;
4676  };
4677 } // namespace details
4678 
4679 /// <summary>
4680 /// Creates a PPL <see cref="task Class">task</see> object. <c>create_task</c> can be used anywhere you would have used a task constructor.
4681 /// It is provided mainly for convenience, because it allows use of the <c>auto</c> keyword while creating tasks.
4682 /// </summary>
4683 /// <typeparam name="_Ty">
4684 /// The type of the parameter from which the task is to be constructed.
4685 /// </typeparam>
4686 /// <param name="_Param">
4687 /// The parameter from which the task is to be constructed. This could be a lambda or function object, a <c>task_completion_event</c>
4688 /// object, a different <c>task</c> object, or a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface if you are using tasks in your Windows Store app.
4689 /// </param>
4690 /// <returns>
4691 /// A new task of type <c>T</c>, that is inferred from <paramref name="_Param"/>.
4692 /// </returns>
4693 /// <remarks>
4694 /// The first overload behaves like a task constructor that takes a single parameter.
4695 /// <para>The second overload associates the cancellation token provided with the newly created task. If you use this overload you are not
4696 /// allowed to pass in a different <c>task</c> object as the first parameter.</para>
4697 /// <para>The type of the returned task is inferred from the first parameter to the function. If <paramref name="_Param"/> is a <c>task_completion_event&lt;T&gt;</c>,
4698 /// a <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>, or a functor that returns either type <c>T</c> or <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>, the type of the created task is <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>.</para>
4699 /// <para>In a Windows Store app, if <paramref name="_Param"/> is of type Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation&lt;T&gt;^ or
4700 /// Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperationWithProgress&lt;T,P&gt;^, or a functor that returns either of those types, the created task will be of type <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>.
4701 /// If <paramref name="_Param"/> is of type Windows::Foundation::IAsyncAction^ or Windows::Foundation::IAsyncActionWithProgress&lt;P&gt;^, or a functor
4702 /// that returns either of those types, the created task will have type <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.</para>
4703 /// </remarks>
4704 /// <seealso cref="task Class"/>
4705 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
4706 /**/
4707 template<typename _Ty>
4708 __declspec(noinline)
4709 auto create_task(_Ty _Param, task_options _TaskOptions = task_options()) -> task<typename details::_TaskTypeFromParam<_Ty>::_Type>
4710 {
4711  static_assert(!std::is_same<typename details::_TaskTypeFromParam<_Ty>::_Type,details::_BadArgType>::value,
4712 #if defined (__cplusplus_winrt)
4713  "incorrect argument for create_task; can be a callable object, an asynchronous operation, or a task_completion_event"
4714 #else /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
4715  "incorrect argument for create_task; can be a callable object or a task_completion_event"
4716 #endif /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
4717  );
4718  details::_get_internal_task_options(_TaskOptions)._set_creation_callstack(_CAPTURE_CALLSTACK());
4719  task<typename details::_TaskTypeFromParam<_Ty>::_Type> _CreatedTask(_Param, _TaskOptions);
4720  return _CreatedTask;
4721 }
4722 
4723 /// <summary>
4724 /// Creates a PPL <see cref="task Class">task</see> object. <c>create_task</c> can be used anywhere you would have used a task constructor.
4725 /// It is provided mainly for convenience, because it allows use of the <c>auto</c> keyword while creating tasks.
4726 /// </summary>
4727 /// <typeparam name="_Ty">
4728 /// The type of the parameter from which the task is to be constructed.
4729 /// </typeparam>
4730 /// <param name="_Param">
4731 /// The parameter from which the task is to be constructed. This could be a lambda or function object, a <c>task_completion_event</c>
4732 /// object, a different <c>task</c> object, or a Windows::Foundation::IAsyncInfo interface if you are using tasks in your Windows Store app.
4733 /// </param>
4734 /// <param name="_Token">
4735 /// The cancellation token to associate with the task. When the source for this token is canceled, cancellation will be requested on the task.
4736 /// </param>
4737 /// <returns>
4738 /// A new task of type <c>T</c>, that is inferred from <paramref name="_Param"/>.
4739 /// </returns>
4740 /// <remarks>
4741 /// The first overload behaves like a task constructor that takes a single parameter.
4742 /// <para>The second overload associates the cancellation token provided with the newly created task. If you use this overload you are not
4743 /// allowed to pass in a different <c>task</c> object as the first parameter.</para>
4744 /// <para>The type of the returned task is inferred from the first parameter to the function. If <paramref name="_Param"/> is a <c>task_completion_event&lt;T&gt;</c>,
4745 /// a <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>, or a functor that returns either type <c>T</c> or <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>, the type of the created task is <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>.</para>
4746 /// <para>In a Windows Store app, if <paramref name="_Param"/> is of type Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation&lt;T&gt;^ or
4747 /// Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperationWithProgress&lt;T,P&gt;^, or a functor that returns either of those types, the created task will be of type <c>task&lt;T&gt;</c>.
4748 /// If <paramref name="_Param"/> is of type Windows::Foundation::IAsyncAction^ or Windows::Foundation::IAsyncActionWithProgress&lt;P&gt;^, or a functor
4749 /// that returns either of those types, the created task will have type <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.</para>
4750 /// </remarks>
4751 /// <seealso cref="task Class"/>
4752 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
4753 /**/
4754 template<typename _ReturnType>
4755 __declspec(noinline)
4756 task<_ReturnType> create_task(const task<_ReturnType>& _Task)
4757 {
4758  task<_ReturnType> _CreatedTask(_Task);
4759  return _CreatedTask;
4760 }
4761 
4762 #if defined (__cplusplus_winrt)
4763 namespace details
4764 {
4765  template<typename _T>
4766  task<_T> _To_task_helper(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation<_T>^ op)
4767  {
4768  return task<_T>(op);
4769  }
4770 
4771  template<typename _T, typename _Progress>
4772  task<_T> _To_task_helper(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperationWithProgress<_T, _Progress>^ op)
4773  {
4774  return task<_T>(op);
4775  }
4776 
4777  inline task<void> _To_task_helper(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncAction^ op)
4778  {
4779  return task<void>(op);
4780  }
4781 
4782  template<typename _Progress>
4783  task<void> _To_task_helper(Windows::Foundation::IAsyncActionWithProgress<_Progress>^ op)
4784  {
4785  return task<void>(op);
4786  }
4787 
4788  template<typename _ProgressType>
4789  class _ProgressDispatcherBase
4790  {
4791  public:
4792 
4793  virtual ~_ProgressDispatcherBase()
4794  {
4795  }
4796 
4797  virtual void _Report(const _ProgressType& _Val) = 0;
4798  };
4799 
4800  template<typename _ProgressType, typename _ClassPtrType>
4801  class _ProgressDispatcher : public _ProgressDispatcherBase<_ProgressType>
4802  {
4803  public:
4804 
4805  virtual ~_ProgressDispatcher()
4806  {
4807  }
4808 
4809  _ProgressDispatcher(_ClassPtrType _Ptr) : _M_ptr(_Ptr)
4810  {
4811  }
4812 
4813  virtual void _Report(const _ProgressType& _Val)
4814  {
4815  _M_ptr->_FireProgress(_Val);
4816  }
4817 
4818  private:
4819 
4820  _ClassPtrType _M_ptr;
4821  };
4822  class _ProgressReporterCtorArgType{};
4823 } // namespace details
4824 
4825 /// <summary>
4826 /// The progress reporter class allows reporting progress notifications of a specific type. Each progress_reporter object is bound
4827 /// to a particular asynchronous action or operation.
4828 /// </summary>
4829 /// <typeparam name="_ProgressType">
4830 /// The payload type of each progress notification reported through the progress reporter.
4831 /// </typeparam>
4832 /// <remarks>
4833 /// This type is only available to Windows Store apps.
4834 /// </remarks>
4835 /// <seealso cref="create_async Function"/>
4836 /**/
4837 template<typename _ProgressType>
4838 class progress_reporter
4839 {
4840  typedef std::shared_ptr<details::_ProgressDispatcherBase<_ProgressType>> _PtrType;
4841 
4842 public:
4843 
4844  /// <summary>
4845  /// Sends a progress report to the asynchronous action or operation to which this progress reporter is bound.
4846  /// </summary>
4847  /// <param name="_Val">
4848  /// The payload to report through a progress notification.
4849  /// </param>
4850  /**/
4851  void report(const _ProgressType& _Val) const
4852  {
4853  _M_dispatcher->_Report(_Val);
4854  }
4855 
4856  template<typename _ClassPtrType>
4857  static progress_reporter _CreateReporter(_ClassPtrType _Ptr)
4858  {
4859  progress_reporter _Reporter;
4860  details::_ProgressDispatcherBase<_ProgressType> *_PDispatcher = new details::_ProgressDispatcher<_ProgressType, _ClassPtrType>(_Ptr);
4861  _Reporter._M_dispatcher = _PtrType(_PDispatcher);
4862  return _Reporter;
4863  }
4864  progress_reporter() {}
4865 
4866 private:
4867  progress_reporter(details::_ProgressReporterCtorArgType);
4868 
4869  _PtrType _M_dispatcher;
4870 };
4871 
4872 namespace details
4873 {
4874  //
4875  // maps internal definitions for AsyncStatus and defines states that are not client visible
4876  //
4877  enum _AsyncStatusInternal
4878  {
4879  _AsyncCreated = -1, // externally invisible
4880  // client visible states (must match AsyncStatus exactly)
4881  _AsyncStarted = 0, // Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus::Started,
4882  _AsyncCompleted = 1, // Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus::Completed,
4883  _AsyncCanceled = 2, // Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus::Canceled,
4884  _AsyncError = 3, // Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus::Error,
4885  // non-client visible internal states
4886  _AsyncCancelPending,
4887  _AsyncClosed,
4888  _AsyncUndefined
4889  };
4890 
4891  //
4892  // designates whether the "GetResults" method returns a single result (after complete fires) or multiple results
4893  // (which are progressively consumable between Start state and before Close is called)
4894  //
4895  enum _AsyncResultType
4896  {
4897  SingleResult = 0x0001,
4898  MultipleResults = 0x0002
4899  };
4900 
4901  // ***************************************************************************
4902  // Template type traits and helpers for async production APIs:
4903  //
4904 
4905  struct _ZeroArgumentFunctor { };
4906  struct _OneArgumentFunctor { };
4907  struct _TwoArgumentFunctor { };
4908 
4909  // ****************************************
4910  // CLASS TYPES:
4911 
4912  // ********************
4913  // TWO ARGUMENTS:
4914 
4915  // non-void arg:
4916  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4917  _Arg1 _Arg1ClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1, _Arg2) const);
4918 
4919  // non-void arg:
4920  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4921  _Arg2 _Arg2ClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1, _Arg2) const);
4922 
4923  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4924  _ReturnType _ReturnTypeClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1, _Arg2) const);
4925 
4926  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4927  _TwoArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1, _Arg2) const);
4928 
4929  // ********************
4930  // ONE ARGUMENT:
4931 
4932  // non-void arg:
4933  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
4934  _Arg1 _Arg1ClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1) const);
4935 
4936  // non-void arg:
4937  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
4938  void _Arg2ClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1) const);
4939 
4940  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
4941  _ReturnType _ReturnTypeClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1) const);
4942 
4943  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
4944  _OneArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType (_Class::*)(_Arg1) const);
4945 
4946  // ********************
4947  // ZERO ARGUMENT:
4948 
4949  // void arg:
4950  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType>
4951  void _Arg1ClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)() const);
4952 
4953  // void arg:
4954  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType>
4955  void _Arg2ClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)() const);
4956 
4957  // void arg:
4958  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType>
4959  _ReturnType _ReturnTypeClassHelperThunk(_ReturnType (_Class::*)() const);
4960 
4961  template<typename _Class, typename _ReturnType>
4962  _ZeroArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType (_Class::*)() const);
4963 
4964  // ****************************************
4965  // POINTER TYPES:
4966 
4967  // ********************
4968  // TWO ARGUMENTS:
4969 
4970  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4971  _Arg1 _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4972 
4973  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4974  _Arg2 _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4975 
4976  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4977  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4978 
4979  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4980  _TwoArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4981 
4982  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4983  _Arg1 _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4984 
4985  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4986  _Arg2 _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4987 
4988  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4989  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4990 
4991  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4992  _TwoArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4993 
4994  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4995  _Arg1 _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4996 
4997  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
4998  _Arg2 _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
4999 
5000  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
5001  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
5002 
5003  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1, typename _Arg2>
5004  _TwoArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1, _Arg2));
5005 
5006  // ********************
5007  // ONE ARGUMENT:
5008 
5009  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5010  _Arg1 _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1));
5011 
5012  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5013  void _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1));
5014 
5015  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5016  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1));
5017 
5018  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5019  _OneArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)(_Arg1));
5020 
5021  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5022  _Arg1 _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1));
5023 
5024  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5025  void _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1));
5026 
5027  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5028  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1));
5029 
5030  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5031  _OneArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)(_Arg1));
5032 
5033  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5034  _Arg1 _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1));
5035 
5036  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5037  void _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1));
5038 
5039  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5040  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1));
5041 
5042  template<typename _ReturnType, typename _Arg1>
5043  _OneArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)(_Arg1));
5044 
5045  // ********************
5046  // ZERO ARGUMENT:
5047 
5048  template<typename _ReturnType>
5049  void _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)());
5050 
5051  template<typename _ReturnType>
5052  void _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)());
5053 
5054  template<typename _ReturnType>
5055  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)());
5056 
5057  template<typename _ReturnType>
5058  _ZeroArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__cdecl *)());
5059 
5060  template<typename _ReturnType>
5061  void _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)());
5062 
5063  template<typename _ReturnType>
5064  void _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)());
5065 
5066  template<typename _ReturnType>
5067  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)());
5068 
5069  template<typename _ReturnType>
5070  _ZeroArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__stdcall *)());
5071 
5072  template<typename _ReturnType>
5073  void _Arg1PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)());
5074 
5075  template<typename _ReturnType>
5076  void _Arg2PFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)());
5077 
5078  template<typename _ReturnType>
5079  _ReturnType _ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)());
5080 
5081  template<typename _ReturnType>
5082  _ZeroArgumentFunctor _ArgumentCountHelper(_ReturnType(__fastcall *)());
5083 
5084  template<typename _T>
5085  struct _FunctorArguments
5086  {
5087  static const size_t _Count = 0;
5088  };
5089 
5090  template<>
5091  struct _FunctorArguments<_OneArgumentFunctor>
5092  {
5093  static const size_t _Count = 1;
5094  };
5095 
5096  template<>
5097  struct _FunctorArguments<_TwoArgumentFunctor>
5098  {
5099  static const size_t _Count = 2;
5100  };
5101 
5102  template<typename _T>
5103  struct _FunctorTypeTraits
5104  {
5105  typedef decltype(_ArgumentCountHelper(&(_T::operator()))) _ArgumentCountType;
5106  static const size_t _ArgumentCount = _FunctorArguments<_ArgumentCountType>::_Count;
5107 
5108  typedef decltype(_ReturnTypeClassHelperThunk(&(_T::operator()))) _ReturnType;
5109  typedef decltype(_Arg1ClassHelperThunk(&(_T::operator()))) _Argument1Type;
5110  typedef decltype(_Arg2ClassHelperThunk(&(_T::operator()))) _Argument2Type;
5111  };
5112 
5113  template<typename _T>
5114  struct _FunctorTypeTraits<_T *>
5115  {
5116  typedef decltype(_ArgumentCountHelper(stdx::declval<_T*>())) _ArgumentCountType;
5117  static const size_t _ArgumentCount = _FunctorArguments<_ArgumentCountType>::_Count;
5118 
5119  typedef decltype(_ReturnTypePFNHelperThunk(stdx::declval<_T*>())) _ReturnType;
5120  typedef decltype(_Arg1PFNHelperThunk(stdx::declval<_T*>())) _Argument1Type;
5121  typedef decltype(_Arg2PFNHelperThunk(stdx::declval<_T*>())) _Argument2Type;
5122  };
5123 
5124  template<typename _T>
5125  struct _ProgressTypeTraits
5126  {
5127  static const bool _TakesProgress = false;
5128  typedef void _ProgressType;
5129  };
5130 
5131  template<typename _T>
5132  struct _ProgressTypeTraits<progress_reporter<_T>>
5133  {
5134  static const bool _TakesProgress = true;
5135  typedef typename _T _ProgressType;
5136  };
5137 
5138 
5139  template<typename _T, size_t count = _FunctorTypeTraits<_T>::_ArgumentCount>
5140  struct _CAFunctorOptions
5141  {
5142  static const bool _TakesProgress = false;
5143  static const bool _TakesToken = false;
5144  typedef void _ProgressType;
5145  };
5146 
5147  template<typename _T>
5148  struct _CAFunctorOptions<_T, 1>
5149  {
5150  private:
5151 
5152  typedef typename _FunctorTypeTraits<_T>::_Argument1Type _Argument1Type;
5153 
5154  public:
5155 
5156  static const bool _TakesProgress = _ProgressTypeTraits<_Argument1Type>::_TakesProgress;
5157  static const bool _TakesToken = !_TakesProgress;
5158  typedef typename _ProgressTypeTraits<_Argument1Type>::_ProgressType _ProgressType;
5159  };
5160 
5161  template<typename _T>
5162  struct _CAFunctorOptions<_T, 2>
5163  {
5164  private:
5165 
5166  typedef typename _FunctorTypeTraits<_T>::_Argument1Type _Argument1Type;
5167 
5168  public:
5169 
5170  static const bool _TakesProgress = true;
5171  static const bool _TakesToken = true;
5172  typedef typename _ProgressTypeTraits<_Argument1Type>::_ProgressType _ProgressType;
5173  };
5174 
5175  ref class _Zip
5176  {
5177  };
5178 
5179  // ***************************************************************************
5180  // Async Operation Task Generators
5181  //
5182 
5183  //
5184  // Functor returns an IAsyncInfo - result needs to be wrapped in a task:
5185  //
5186  template<typename _AsyncSelector, typename _ReturnType>
5187  struct _SelectorTaskGenerator
5188  {
5189  template<typename _Function>
5190  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_0(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5191  {
5192  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5193  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5194  return task<_ReturnType>(_Func(), _taskOptinos);
5195  }
5196 
5197  template<typename _Function>
5198  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_1C(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5199  {
5200  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5201  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5202  return task<_ReturnType>(_Func(_Cts.get_token()), _taskOptinos);
5203  }
5204 
5205  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5206  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_1P(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5207  {
5208  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5209  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5210  return task<_ReturnType>(_Func(_Progress), _taskOptinos);
5211  }
5212 
5213  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5214  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_2PC(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5215  {
5216  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5217  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5218  return task<_ReturnType>(_Func(_Progress, _Cts.get_token()), _taskOptinos);
5219  }
5220  };
5221 
5222  template<typename _AsyncSelector>
5223  struct _SelectorTaskGenerator<_AsyncSelector, void>
5224  {
5225  template<typename _Function>
5226  static task<void> _GenerateTask_0(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5227  {
5228  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5229  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5230  return task<void>(_Func(), _taskOptinos);
5231  }
5232 
5233  template<typename _Function>
5234  static task<void> _GenerateTask_1C(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5235  {
5236  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5237  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5238  return task<void>(_Func(_Cts.get_token()), _taskOptinos);
5239  }
5240 
5241  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5242  static task<void> _GenerateTask_1P(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5243  {
5244  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5245  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5246  return task<void>(_Func(_Progress), _taskOptinos);
5247  }
5248 
5249  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5250  static task<void> _GenerateTask_2PC(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5251  {
5252  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5253  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5254  return task<void>(_Func(_Progress, _Cts.get_token()), _taskOptinos);
5255  }
5256  };
5257 
5258  //
5259  // Functor returns a result - it needs to be wrapped in a task:
5260  //
5261  template<typename _ReturnType>
5262  struct _SelectorTaskGenerator<_TypeSelectorNoAsync, _ReturnType>
5263  {
5264 
5265 #pragma warning(push)
5266 #pragma warning(disable: 4702)
5267  template<typename _Function>
5268  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_0(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5269  {
5270  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5271  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5272  return task<_ReturnType>( [=]() -> _ReturnType {
5273  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5274  (_Oversubscriber);
5275  return _Func();
5276  }, _taskOptinos);
5277  }
5278 #pragma warning(pop)
5279 
5280  template<typename _Function>
5281  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_1C(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5282  {
5283  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5284  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5285  return task<_ReturnType>( [=]() -> _ReturnType {
5286  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5287  (_Oversubscriber);
5288  return _Func(_Cts.get_token());
5289  }, _taskOptinos);
5290  }
5291 
5292  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5293  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_1P(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5294  {
5295  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5296  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5297  return task<_ReturnType>( [=]() -> _ReturnType {
5298  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5299  (_Oversubscriber);
5300  return _Func(_Progress);
5301  }, _taskOptinos);
5302  }
5303 
5304  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5305  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_2PC(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5306  {
5307  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5308  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5309  return task<_ReturnType>( [=]() -> _ReturnType {
5310  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5311  (_Oversubscriber);
5312  return _Func(_Progress, _Cts.get_token());
5313  }, _taskOptinos);
5314  }
5315  };
5316 
5317  template<>
5318  struct _SelectorTaskGenerator<_TypeSelectorNoAsync, void>
5319  {

5322  {
5323  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5324  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5325  return task<void>( [=]() {
5326  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5327  (_Oversubscriber);
5328  _Func();
5329  }, _taskOptinos);
5330  }
5331

5333  static task<void> _GenerateTask_1C(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5334  {
5335  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5336  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5337  return task<void>( [=]() {
5338  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5339  (_Oversubscriber);
5340  _Func(_Cts.get_token());
5341  }, _taskOptinos);
5342  }
5343 
5344  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5345  static task<void> _GenerateTask_1P(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5346  {
5347  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5348  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5349  return task<void>( [=]() {
5350  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5351  (_Oversubscriber);
5352  _Func(_Progress);
5353  }, _taskOptinos);
5354  }

5356  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5357  static task<void> _GenerateTask_2PC(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5358  {
5359  task_options _taskOptinos(_Cts.get_token());
5360  details::_get_internal_task_options(_taskOptinos)._set_creation_callstack(_callstack);
5361  return task<void>( [=]() {
5362  _Task_generator_oversubscriber_t _Oversubscriber;
5363  (_Oversubscriber);
5364  _Func(_Progress, _Cts.get_token());
5365  }, _taskOptinos);
5366  }
5367  };

5369  //
5370  // Functor returns a task - the task can directly be returned:
5371  //
5372  template<typename _ReturnType>
5373  struct _SelectorTaskGenerator<_TypeSelectorAsyncTask, _ReturnType>
5374  {
5375  template<typename _Function>
5376  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_0(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5377  {
5378  return _Func();
5379  }
5380 
5381  template<typename _Function>
5382  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_1C(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5383  {
5384  return _Func(_Cts.get_token());
5385  }
5386 
5387  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5388  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_1P(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5389  {
5390  return _Func(_Progress);
5391  }
5392 
5393  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5394  static task<_ReturnType> _GenerateTask_2PC(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5395  {
5396  return _Func(_Progress, _Cts.get_token());
5397  }
5398  };
5399 
5400  template<>
5401  struct _SelectorTaskGenerator<_TypeSelectorAsyncTask, void>
5402  {
5403  template<typename _Function>
5404  static task<void> _GenerateTask_0(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5405  {
5406  return _Func();
5407  }
5408 
5409  template<typename _Function>
5410  static task<void> _GenerateTask_1C(const _Function& _Func, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5411  {
5412  return _Func(_Cts.get_token());
5413  }
5414 
5415  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5416  static task<void> _GenerateTask_1P(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5417  {
5418  return _Func(_Progress);
5419  }
5420 
5421  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressObject>
5422  static task<void> _GenerateTask_2PC(const _Function& _Func, const _ProgressObject& _Progress, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5423  {
5424  return _Func(_Progress, _Cts.get_token());
5425  }
5426  };
5427 
5428  template<typename _Generator, bool _TakesToken, bool TakesProgress>
5429  struct _TaskGenerator
5430  {
5431  };
5432 
5433  template<typename _Generator>
5434  struct _TaskGenerator<_Generator, false, false>
5435  {
5436  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr, typename _ProgressType>
5437  static auto _GenerateTask(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5438  -> decltype(_Generator::_GenerateTask_0(_Func, _Cts, _callstack))
5439  {
5440  return _Generator::_GenerateTask_0(_Func, _Cts, _callstack);
5441  }
5442  };
5443 
5444  template<typename _Generator>
5445  struct _TaskGenerator<_Generator, true, false>
5446  {
5447  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr, typename _ProgressType>
5448  static auto _GenerateTask(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5449  -> decltype(_Generator::_GenerateTask_0(_Func, _Cts, _callstack))
5450  {
5451  return _Generator::_GenerateTask_1C(_Func, _Cts, _callstack);
5452  }
5453  };
5454 
5455  template<typename _Generator>
5456  struct _TaskGenerator<_Generator, false, true>
5457  {
5458  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr, typename _ProgressType>
5459  static auto _GenerateTask(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5460  -> decltype(_Generator::_GenerateTask_0(_Func, _Cts, _callstack))
5461  {
5462  return _Generator::_GenerateTask_1P(_Func, progress_reporter<_ProgressType>::_CreateReporter(_Ptr), _Cts, _callstack);
5463  }
5464  };
5465 
5466  template<typename _Generator>
5467  struct _TaskGenerator<_Generator, true, true>
5468  {
5469  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr, typename _ProgressType>
5470  static auto _GenerateTask(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5471  -> decltype(_Generator::_GenerateTask_0(_Func, _Cts, _callstack))
5472  {
5473  return _Generator::_GenerateTask_2PC(_Func, progress_reporter<_ProgressType>::_CreateReporter(_Ptr), _Cts, _callstack);
5474  }
5475  };
5476 
5477  // ***************************************************************************
5478  // Async Operation Attributes Classes
5479  //
5480  // These classes are passed through the hierarchy of async base classes in order to hold multiple attributes of a given async construct in
5481  // a single container. An attribute class must define:
5482  //
5483  // Mandatory:
5484  // -------------------------
5485  //
5486  // _AsyncBaseType : The Windows Runtime interface which is being implemented.
5487  // _CompletionDelegateType : The Windows Runtime completion delegate type for the interface.
5488  // _ProgressDelegateType : If _TakesProgress is true, the Windows Runtime progress delegate type for the interface. If it is false, an empty Windows Runtime type.
5489  // _ReturnType : The return type of the async construct (void for actions / non-void for operations)
5490  //
5491  // _TakesProgress : An indication as to whether or not
5492  //
5493  // _Generate_Task : A function adapting the user's function into what's necessary to produce the appropriate task
5494  //
5495  // Optional:
5496  // -------------------------
5497  //
5498 
5499  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressType, typename _ReturnType, typename _TaskTraits, bool _TakesToken, bool _TakesProgress>
5500  struct _AsyncAttributes
5501  {
5502  };
5503 
5504  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressType, typename _ReturnType, typename _TaskTraits, bool _TakesToken>
5505  struct _AsyncAttributes<_Function, _ProgressType, _ReturnType, _TaskTraits, _TakesToken, true>
5506  {
5507  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperationWithProgress<_ReturnType, _ProgressType> _AsyncBaseType;
5508  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::AsyncOperationProgressHandler<_ReturnType, _ProgressType> _ProgressDelegateType;
5509  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::AsyncOperationWithProgressCompletedHandler<_ReturnType, _ProgressType> _CompletionDelegateType;
5510  typedef typename _ReturnType _ReturnType;
5511  typedef typename _ProgressType _ProgressType;
5512  typedef typename _TaskTraits::_AsyncKind _AsyncKind;
5513  typedef typename _SelectorTaskGenerator<_AsyncKind, _ReturnType> _SelectorTaskGenerator;
5514  typedef typename _TaskGenerator<_SelectorTaskGenerator, _TakesToken, true> _TaskGenerator;
5515 
5516  static const bool _TakesProgress = true;
5517  static const bool _TakesToken = _TakesToken;
5518 
5519  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr>
5520  static task<_ReturnType> _Generate_Task(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5521  {
5522  return _TaskGenerator::_GenerateTask<_Function, _ClassPtr, _ProgressType>(_Func, _Ptr, _Cts, _callstack);
5523  }
5524  };
5525 
5526  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressType, typename _ReturnType, typename _TaskTraits, bool _TakesToken>
5527  struct _AsyncAttributes<_Function, _ProgressType, _ReturnType, _TaskTraits, _TakesToken, false>
5528  {
5529  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::IAsyncOperation<_ReturnType> _AsyncBaseType;
5530  typedef _Zip _ProgressDelegateType;
5531  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::AsyncOperationCompletedHandler<_ReturnType> _CompletionDelegateType;
5532  typedef typename _ReturnType _ReturnType;
5533  typedef typename _TaskTraits::_AsyncKind _AsyncKind;
5534  typedef typename _SelectorTaskGenerator<_AsyncKind, _ReturnType> _SelectorTaskGenerator;
5535  typedef typename _TaskGenerator<_SelectorTaskGenerator, _TakesToken, false> _TaskGenerator;
5536 
5537  static const bool _TakesProgress = false;
5538  static const bool _TakesToken = _TakesToken;
5539 
5540  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr>
5541  static task<_ReturnType> _Generate_Task(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5542  {
5543  return _TaskGenerator::_GenerateTask<_Function, _ClassPtr, _ProgressType>(_Func, _Ptr, _Cts, _callstack);
5544  }
5545  };
5546 
5547  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressType, typename _TaskTraits, bool _TakesToken>
5548  struct _AsyncAttributes<_Function, _ProgressType, void, _TaskTraits, _TakesToken, true>
5549  {
5550  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::IAsyncActionWithProgress<_ProgressType> _AsyncBaseType;
5551  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::AsyncActionProgressHandler<_ProgressType> _ProgressDelegateType;
5552  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::AsyncActionWithProgressCompletedHandler<_ProgressType> _CompletionDelegateType;
5553  typedef void _ReturnType;
5554  typedef typename _ProgressType _ProgressType;
5555  typedef typename _TaskTraits::_AsyncKind _AsyncKind;
5556  typedef typename _SelectorTaskGenerator<_AsyncKind, _ReturnType> _SelectorTaskGenerator;
5557  typedef typename _TaskGenerator<_SelectorTaskGenerator, _TakesToken, true> _TaskGenerator;
5558 
5559  static const bool _TakesProgress = true;
5560  static const bool _TakesToken = _TakesToken;
5561 
5562  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr>
5563  static task<_ReturnType> _Generate_Task(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5564  {
5565  return _TaskGenerator::_GenerateTask<_Function, _ClassPtr, _ProgressType>(_Func, _Ptr, _Cts, _callstack);
5566  }
5567  };
5568 
5569  template<typename _Function, typename _ProgressType, typename _TaskTraits, bool _TakesToken>
5570  struct _AsyncAttributes<_Function, _ProgressType, void, _TaskTraits, _TakesToken, false>
5571  {
5572  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::IAsyncAction _AsyncBaseType;
5573  typedef _Zip _ProgressDelegateType;
5574  typedef typename Windows::Foundation::AsyncActionCompletedHandler _CompletionDelegateType;
5575  typedef void _ReturnType;
5576  typedef typename _TaskTraits::_AsyncKind _AsyncKind;
5577  typedef typename _SelectorTaskGenerator<_AsyncKind, _ReturnType> _SelectorTaskGenerator;
5578  typedef typename _TaskGenerator<_SelectorTaskGenerator, _TakesToken, false> _TaskGenerator;
5579 
5580  static const bool _TakesProgress = false;
5581  static const bool _TakesToken = _TakesToken;
5582 
5583  template<typename _Function, typename _ClassPtr>
5584  static task<_ReturnType> _Generate_Task(const _Function& _Func, _ClassPtr _Ptr, cancellation_token_source _Cts, const _TaskCreationCallstack & _callstack)
5585  {
5586  return _TaskGenerator::_GenerateTask<_Function, _ClassPtr, _ProgressType>(_Func, _Ptr, _Cts, _callstack);
5587  }
5588  };
5589 
5590  template<typename _Function>
5591  struct _AsyncLambdaTypeTraits
5592  {
5593  typedef typename _FunctorTypeTraits<_Function>::_ReturnType _ReturnType;
5594  typedef typename _FunctorTypeTraits<_Function>::_Argument1Type _Argument1Type;
5595  typedef typename _CAFunctorOptions<_Function>::_ProgressType _ProgressType;
5596 
5597  static const bool _TakesProgress = _CAFunctorOptions<_Function>::_TakesProgress;
5598  static const bool _TakesToken = _CAFunctorOptions<_Function>::_TakesToken;
5599 
5600  typedef typename _TaskTypeTraits<_ReturnType> _TaskTraits;
5601  typedef typename _AsyncAttributes<_Function, _ProgressType, typename _TaskTraits::_TaskRetType, _TaskTraits, _TakesToken, _TakesProgress> _AsyncAttributes;
5602  };
5603 
5604  // ***************************************************************************
5605  // AsyncInfo (and completion) Layer:
5606  //
5607 
5608  //
5609  // Internal base class implementation for async operations (based on internal Windows representation for ABI level async operations)
5610  //
5611  template < typename _Attributes, _AsyncResultType resultType = SingleResult >
5612  ref class _AsyncInfoBase abstract : _Attributes::_AsyncBaseType
5613  {
5614  internal:
5615 
5616  _AsyncInfoBase() :
5617  _M_currentStatus(_AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCreated),
5618  _M_errorCode(S_OK),
5619  _M_completeDelegate(nullptr),
5620  _M_CompleteDelegateAssigned(0),
5621  _M_CallbackMade(0)
5622  {
5623  _M_id = ::pplx::details::platform::GetNextAsyncId();
5624  }
5625 
5626  public:
5627  virtual typename _Attributes::_ReturnType GetResults()
5628  {
5629  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_UNEXPECTED);
5630  }
5631 
5632  virtual property unsigned int Id
5633  {
5634  unsigned int get()
5635  {
5636  _CheckValidStateForAsyncInfoCall();
5637 
5638  return _M_id;
5639  }
5640 
5641  void set(unsigned int id)
5642  {
5643  _CheckValidStateForAsyncInfoCall();
5644 
5645  if (id == 0)
5646  {
5647  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_INVALIDARG);
5648  }
5649  else if (_M_currentStatus != _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCreated)
5650  {
5651  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_METHOD_CALL);
5652  }
5653 
5654  _M_id = id;
5655  }
5656  }
5657 
5658  virtual property Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus Status
5659  {
5660  Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus get()
5661  {
5662  _CheckValidStateForAsyncInfoCall();
5663 
5664  _AsyncStatusInternal _Current = _M_currentStatus;
5665 
5666  //
5667  // Map our internal cancel pending to cancelled. This way "pending cancelled" looks to the outside as "cancelled" but
5668  // can still transition to "completed" if the operation completes without acknowledging the cancellation request
5669  //
5670  switch(_Current)
5671  {
5672  case _AsyncCancelPending:
5673  _Current = _AsyncCanceled;
5674  break;
5675  case _AsyncCreated:
5676  _Current = _AsyncStarted;
5677  break;
5678  default:
5679  break;
5680  }
5681 
5682  return static_cast<Windows::Foundation::AsyncStatus>(_Current);
5683  }
5684  }
5685 
5686  virtual property Windows::Foundation::HResult ErrorCode
5687  {
5688  Windows::Foundation::HResult get()
5689  {
5690  _CheckValidStateForAsyncInfoCall();
5691 
5692  Windows::Foundation::HResult _Hr;
5693  _Hr.Value = _M_errorCode;
5694  return _Hr;
5695  }
5696  }
5697 
5698  virtual property typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ Progress
5699  {
5700  typename typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ get()
5701  {
5702  return _GetOnProgress();
5703  }
5704 
5705  void set(typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ _ProgressHandler)
5706  {
5707  _PutOnProgress(_ProgressHandler);
5708  }
5709  }
5710 
5711  virtual void Cancel()
5712  {
5713  if (_TransitionToState(_AsyncCancelPending))
5714  {
5715  _OnCancel();
5716  }
5717  }
5718 
5719  virtual void Close()
5720  {
5721  if (_TransitionToState(_AsyncClosed))
5722  {
5723  _OnClose();
5724  }
5725  else
5726  {
5727  if (_M_currentStatus != _AsyncClosed) // Closed => Closed transition is just ignored
5728  {
5729  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_STATE_CHANGE);
5730  }
5731  }
5732  }
5733 
5734  virtual property typename _Attributes::_CompletionDelegateType^ Completed
5735  {
5736  typename _Attributes::_CompletionDelegateType^ get()
5737  {
5738  _CheckValidStateForDelegateCall();
5739  return _M_completeDelegate;
5740  }
5741 
5742  void set(typename _Attributes::_CompletionDelegateType^ _CompleteHandler)
5743  {
5744  _CheckValidStateForDelegateCall();
5745  // this delegate property is "write once"
5746  if (InterlockedIncrement(&_M_CompleteDelegateAssigned) == 1)
5747  {
5748  _M_completeDelegateContext = _ContextCallback::_CaptureCurrent();
5749  _M_completeDelegate = _CompleteHandler;
5750  // Guarantee that the write of _M_completeDelegate is ordered with respect to the read of state below
5751  // as perceived from _FireCompletion on another thread.
5752  MemoryBarrier();
5753  if (_IsTerminalState())
5754  {
5755  _FireCompletion();
5756  }
5757  }
5758  else
5759  {
5760  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_DELEGATE_ASSIGNMENT);
5761  }
5762  }
5763  }
5764 
5765 
5766  protected private:
5767 
5768  // _Start - this is not externally visible since async operations "hot start" before returning to the caller
5769  void _Start()
5770  {
5771  if (_TransitionToState(_AsyncStarted))
5772  {
5773  _OnStart();
5774  }
5775  else
5776  {
5777  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_STATE_CHANGE);
5778  }
5779  }
5780 
5781 
5782  void _FireCompletion()
5783  {
5784  _TryTransitionToCompleted();
5785 
5786  // we guarantee that completion can only ever be fired once
5787  if (_M_completeDelegate != nullptr && InterlockedIncrement(&_M_CallbackMade) == 1)
5788  {
5789  _M_completeDelegateContext._CallInContext([=] {
5790  _M_completeDelegate((_Attributes::_AsyncBaseType^)this, this->Status);
