5791  _M_completeDelegate = nullptr;
5792  });
5793  }
5794  }
5795 
5796  virtual typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ _GetOnProgress()
5797  {
5798  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_UNEXPECTED);
5799  }
5800 
5801  virtual void _PutOnProgress(typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ _ProgressHandler)
5802  {
5803  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_UNEXPECTED);
5804  }
5805 
5806  bool _TryTransitionToCompleted()
5807  {
5808  return _TransitionToState(_AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCompleted);
5809  }
5810 
5811  bool _TryTransitionToCancelled()
5812  {
5813  return _TransitionToState(_AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCanceled);
5814  }
5815 
5816  bool _TryTransitionToError(const HRESULT error)
5817  {
5818  _InterlockedCompareExchange(reinterpret_cast<volatile LONG*>(&_M_errorCode), error, S_OK);
5819  return _TransitionToState(_AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncError);
5820  }
5821 
5822  // This method checks to see if the delegate properties can be
5823  // modified in the current state and generates the appropriate
5824  // error hr in the case of violation.
5825  inline void _CheckValidStateForDelegateCall()
5826  {
5827  if (_M_currentStatus == _AsyncClosed)
5828  {
5829  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_METHOD_CALL);
5830  }
5831  }
5832 
5833  // This method checks to see if results can be collected in the
5834  // current state and generates the appropriate error hr in
5835  // the case of a violation.
5836  inline void _CheckValidStateForResultsCall()
5837  {
5838  _AsyncStatusInternal _Current = _M_currentStatus;
5839 
5840  if (_Current == _AsyncError)
5841  {
5842  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(_M_errorCode);
5843  }
5844 #pragma warning(push)
5845 #pragma warning(disable: 4127) // Conditional expression is constant
5846  // single result illegal before transition to Completed or Cancelled state
5847  if (resultType == SingleResult)
5848 #pragma warning(pop)
5849  {
5850  if (_Current != _AsyncCompleted)
5851  {
5852  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_METHOD_CALL);
5853  }
5854  }
5855  // multiple results can be called after Start has been called and before/after Completed
5856  else if (_Current != _AsyncStarted &&
5857  _Current != _AsyncCancelPending &&
5858  _Current != _AsyncCanceled &&
5859  _Current != _AsyncCompleted)
5860  {
5861  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_METHOD_CALL);
5862  }
5863  }
5864 
5865  // This method can be called by derived classes periodically to determine
5866  // whether the asynchronous operation should continue processing or should
5867  // be halted.
5868  inline bool _ContinueAsyncOperation()
5869  {
5870  return (_M_currentStatus == _AsyncStarted);
5871  }
5872 
5873  // These two methods are used to allow the async worker implementation do work on
5874  // state transitions. No real "work" should be done in these methods. In other words
5875  // they should not block for a long time on UI timescales.
5876  virtual void _OnStart() = 0;
5877  virtual void _OnClose() = 0;
5878  virtual void _OnCancel() = 0;
5879 
5880  private:
5881 
5882  // This method is used to check if calls to the AsyncInfo properties
5883  // (id, status, errorcode) are legal in the current state. It also
5884  // generates the appropriate error hr to return in the case of an
5885  // illegal call.
5886  inline void _CheckValidStateForAsyncInfoCall()
5887  {
5888  _AsyncStatusInternal _Current = _M_currentStatus;
5889  if (_Current == _AsyncClosed)
5890  {
5891  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ILLEGAL_METHOD_CALL);
5892  }
5893  else if (_Current == _AsyncCreated)
5894  {
5895  throw ::Platform::Exception::CreateException(E_ASYNC_OPERATION_NOT_STARTED);
5896  }
5897 
5898  }
5899 
5900  inline bool _TransitionToState(const _AsyncStatusInternal _NewState)
5901  {
5902  _AsyncStatusInternal _Current = _M_currentStatus;
5903 
5904  // This enforces the valid state transitions of the asynchronous worker object
5905  // state machine.
5906  switch(_NewState)
5907  {
5908  case _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncStarted:
5909  if (_Current != _AsyncCreated)
5910  {
5911  return false;
5912  }
5913  break;
5914  case _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCompleted:
5915  if (_Current != _AsyncStarted && _Current != _AsyncCancelPending)
5916  {
5917  return false;
5918  }
5919  break;
5920  case _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCancelPending:
5921  if (_Current != _AsyncStarted)
5922  {
5923  return false;
5924  }
5925  break;
5926  case _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncCanceled:
5927  if (_Current != _AsyncStarted && _Current != _AsyncCancelPending)
5928  {
5929  return false;
5930  }
5931  break;
5932  case _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncError:
5933  if (_Current != _AsyncStarted && _Current != _AsyncCancelPending)
5934  {
5935  return false;
5936  }
5937  break;
5938  case _AsyncStatusInternal::_AsyncClosed:
5939  if (!_IsTerminalState(_Current))
5940  {
5941  return false;
5942  }
5943  break;
5944  default:
5945  return false;
5946  break;
5947  }
5948 
5949  // attempt the transition to the new state
5950  // Note: if currentStatus_ == _Current, then there was no intervening write
5951  // by the async work object and the swap succeeded.
5952  _AsyncStatusInternal _RetState = static_cast<_AsyncStatusInternal>(
5953  _InterlockedCompareExchange(reinterpret_cast<volatile LONG*>(&_M_currentStatus),
5954  _NewState,
5955  static_cast<LONG>(_Current)));
5956 
5957  // ICE returns the former state, if the returned state and the
5958  // state we captured at the beginning of this method are the same,
5959  // the swap succeeded.
5960  return (_RetState == _Current);
5961  }
5962 
5963  inline bool _IsTerminalState()
5964  {
5965  return _IsTerminalState(_M_currentStatus);
5966  }
5967 
5968  inline bool _IsTerminalState(_AsyncStatusInternal status)
5969  {
5970  return (status == _AsyncError ||
5971  status == _AsyncCanceled ||
5972  status == _AsyncCompleted ||
5973  status == _AsyncClosed);
5974  }
5975 
5976  private:
5977 
5978  _ContextCallback _M_completeDelegateContext;
5979  typename _Attributes::_CompletionDelegateType^ volatile _M_completeDelegate;
5980  _AsyncStatusInternal volatile _M_currentStatus;
5981  HRESULT volatile _M_errorCode;
5982  unsigned int _M_id;
5983  long volatile _M_CompleteDelegateAssigned;
5984  long volatile _M_CallbackMade;
5985  };
5986 
5987  // ***************************************************************************
5988  // Progress Layer (optional):
5989  //
5990 
5991  template< typename _Attributes, bool _HasProgress, _AsyncResultType _ResultType = SingleResult >
5992  ref class _AsyncProgressBase abstract : _AsyncInfoBase<_Attributes, _ResultType>
5993  {
5994  };
5995 
5996  template< typename _Attributes, _AsyncResultType _ResultType>
5997  ref class _AsyncProgressBase<_Attributes, true, _ResultType> abstract : _AsyncInfoBase<_Attributes, _ResultType>
5998  {
5999  internal:
6000 
6001  _AsyncProgressBase() : _AsyncInfoBase<_Attributes, _ResultType>(),
6002  _M_progressDelegate(nullptr)
6003  {
6004  }
6005 
6006  virtual typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ _GetOnProgress() override
6007  {
6008  _CheckValidStateForDelegateCall();
6009  return _M_progressDelegate;
6010  }
6011 
6012  virtual void _PutOnProgress(typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ _ProgressHandler) override
6013  {
6014  _CheckValidStateForDelegateCall();
6015  _M_progressDelegate = _ProgressHandler;
6016  _M_progressDelegateContext = _ContextCallback::_CaptureCurrent();
6017  }
6018 
6019  void _FireProgress(const typename _Attributes::_ProgressType& _ProgressValue)
6020  {
6021  if (_M_progressDelegate != nullptr)
6022  {
6023  _M_progressDelegateContext._CallInContext([=] {
6024  _M_progressDelegate((_Attributes::_AsyncBaseType^)this, _ProgressValue);
6025  });
6026  }
6027  }
6028 
6029  private:
6030 
6031  _ContextCallback _M_progressDelegateContext;
6032  typename _Attributes::_ProgressDelegateType^ _M_progressDelegate;
6033  };
6034 
6035  template<typename _Attributes, _AsyncResultType _ResultType = SingleResult>
6036  ref class _AsyncBaseProgressLayer abstract : _AsyncProgressBase<_Attributes, _Attributes::_TakesProgress, _ResultType>
6037  {
6038  };
6039 
6040  // ***************************************************************************
6041  // Task Adaptation Layer:
6042  //
6043 
6044  //
6045  // _AsyncTaskThunkBase provides a bridge between IAsync<Action/Operation> and task.
6046  //
6047  template<typename _Attributes, typename _ReturnType>
6048  ref class _AsyncTaskThunkBase abstract : _AsyncBaseProgressLayer<_Attributes>
6049  {
6050  public:
6051 
6052  virtual _ReturnType GetResults() override
6053  {
6054  _CheckValidStateForResultsCall();
6055  return _M_task.get();
6056  }
6057 
6058  internal:
6059 
6060  typedef task<_ReturnType> _TaskType;
6061 
6062  _AsyncTaskThunkBase(const _TaskType& _Task)
6063  : _M_task(_Task)
6064  {
6065  }
6066 
6067  _AsyncTaskThunkBase()
6068  {
6069  }
6070 
6071  protected:
6072 
6073  virtual void _OnStart() override
6074  {
6075  _M_task.then( [=](_TaskType _Antecedent) {
6076  try
6077  {
6078  _Antecedent.get();
6079  }
6080  catch(task_canceled&)
6081  {
6082  _TryTransitionToCancelled();
6083  }
6084  catch(::Platform::Exception^ _Ex)
6085  {
6086  _TryTransitionToError(_Ex->HResult);
6087  }
6088  catch(...)
6089  {
6090  _TryTransitionToError(E_FAIL);
6091  }
6092  _FireCompletion();
6093  });
6094  }
6095 
6096  internal:
6097 
6098  _TaskType _M_task;
6099  cancellation_token_source _M_cts;
6100  };
6101 
6102  template<typename _Attributes>
6103  ref class _AsyncTaskThunk : _AsyncTaskThunkBase<_Attributes, typename _Attributes::_ReturnType>
6104  {
6105  internal:
6106 
6107  _AsyncTaskThunk(const _TaskType& _Task) :
6108  _AsyncTaskThunkBase(_Task)
6109  {
6110  }
6111 
6112  _AsyncTaskThunk()
6113  {
6114  }
6115 
6116  protected:
6117 
6118  virtual void _OnClose() override
6119  {
6120  }
6121 
6122  virtual void _OnCancel() override
6123  {
6124  _M_cts.cancel();
6125  }
6126  };
6127 
6128  // ***************************************************************************
6129  // Async Creation Layer:
6130  //
6131  template<typename _Function>
6132  ref class _AsyncTaskGeneratorThunk sealed : _AsyncTaskThunk<typename _AsyncLambdaTypeTraits<_Function>::_AsyncAttributes>
6133  {
6134  internal:
6135 
6136  typedef typename _AsyncLambdaTypeTraits<_Function>::_AsyncAttributes _Attributes;
6137  typedef typename _AsyncTaskThunk<_Attributes> _Base;
6138  typedef typename _Attributes::_AsyncBaseType _AsyncBaseType;
6139 
6140  _AsyncTaskGeneratorThunk(const _Function& _Func, const _TaskCreationCallstack &_callstack) : _M_func(_Func), _M_creationCallstack(_callstack)
6141  {
6142  // Virtual call here is safe as the class is declared 'sealed'
6143  _Start();
6144  }
6145 
6146  protected:
6147 
6148  //
6149  // The only thing we must do different from the base class is we must spin the hot task on transition from Created->Started. Otherwise,
6150  // let the base thunk handle everything.
6151  //
6152 
6153  virtual void _OnStart() override
6154  {
6155  //
6156  // Call the appropriate task generator to actually produce a task of the expected type. This might adapt the user lambda for progress reports,
6157  // wrap the return result in a task, or allow for direct return of a task depending on the form of the lambda.
6158  //
6159  _M_task = _Attributes::_Generate_Task(_M_func, this, _M_cts, _M_creationCallstack);
6160  _Base::_OnStart();
6161  }
6162 
6163  virtual void _OnCancel() override
6164  {
6165  _Base::_OnCancel();
6166  }
6167 
6168  private:
6169  _TaskCreationCallstack _M_creationCallstack;
6170  _Function _M_func;
6171  };
6172 } // namespace details
6173 
6174 /// <summary>
6175 /// Creates a Windows Runtime asynchronous construct based on a user supplied lambda or function object. The return type of <c>create_async</c> is
6176 /// one of either <c>IAsyncAction^</c>, <c>IAsyncActionWithProgress&lt;TProgress&gt;^</c>, <c>IAsyncOperation&lt;TResult&gt;^</c>, or
6177 /// <c>IAsyncOperationWithProgress&lt;TResult, TProgress&gt;^</c> based on the signature of the lambda passed to the method.
6178 /// </summary>
6179 /// <param name="_Func">
6180 /// The lambda or function object from which to create a Windows Runtime asynchronous construct.
6181 /// </param>
6182 /// <returns>
6183 /// An asynchronous construct represented by an IAsyncAction^, IAsyncActionWithProgress&lt;TProgress&gt;^, IAsyncOperation&lt;TResult&gt;^, or an
6184 /// IAsyncOperationWithProgress&lt;TResult, TProgress&gt;^. The interface returned depends on the signature of the lambda passed into the function.
6185 /// </returns>
6186 /// <remarks>
6187 /// The return type of the lambda determines whether the construct is an action or an operation.
6188 /// <para>Lambdas that return void cause the creation of actions. Lambdas that return a result of type <c>TResult</c> cause the creation of
6189 /// operations of TResult.</para>
6190 /// <para>The lambda may also return a <c>task&lt;TResult&gt;</c> which encapsulates the aysnchronous work within itself or is the continuation of
6191 /// a chain of tasks that represent the asynchronous work. In this case, the lambda itself is executed inline, since the tasks are the ones that
6192 /// execute asynchronously, and the return type of the lambda is unwrapped to produce the asynchronous construct returned by <c>create_async</c>.
6193 /// This implies that a lambda that returns a task&lt;void&gt; will cause the creation of actions, and a lambda that returns a task&lt;TResult&gt; will
6194 /// cause the creation of operations of TResult.</para>
6195 /// <para>The lambda may take either zero, one or two arguments. The valid arguments are <c>progress_reporter&lt;TProgress&gt;</c> and
6196 /// <c>cancellation_token</c>, in that order if both are used. A lambda without arguments causes the creation of an asynchronous construct without
6197 /// the capability for progress reporting. A lambda that takes a progress_reporter&lt;TProgress&gt; will cause <c>create_async</c> to return an asynchronous
6198 /// construct which reports progress of type TProgress each time the <c>report</c> method of the progress_reporter object is called. A lambda that
6199 /// takes a cancellation_token may use that token to check for cancellation, or pass it to tasks that it creates so that cancellation of the
6200 /// asynchronous construct causes cancellation of those tasks.</para>
6201 /// <para>If the body of the lambda or function object returns a result (and not a task&lt;TResult&gt;), the lamdba will be executed
6202 /// asynchronously within the process MTA in the context of a task the Runtime implicitly creates for it. The <c>IAsyncInfo::Cancel</c> method will
6203 /// cause cancellation of the implicit task.</para>
6204 /// <para>If the body of the lambda returns a task, the lamba executes inline, and by declaring the lambda to take an argument of type
6205 /// <c>cancellation_token</c> you can trigger cancellation of any tasks you create within the lambda by passing that token in when you create them.
6206 /// You may also use the <c>register_callback</c> method on the token to cause the Runtime to invoke a callback when you call <c>IAsyncInfo::Cancel</c> on
6207 /// the async operation or action produced..</para>
6208 /// <para>This function is only available to Windows Store apps.</para>
6209 /// </remarks>
6210 /// <seealso cref="task Class"/>
6211 /// <seealso cref="progress_reporter Class"/>
6212 /// <seealso cref="cancelation_token Class"/>
6213 /**/
6214 template<typename _Function>
6215 __declspec(noinline)
6216 details::_AsyncTaskGeneratorThunk<_Function> ^create_async(const _Function& _Func)
6217 {
6218  static_assert(std::is_same<decltype(details::_IsValidCreateAsync(_Func,0,0,0,0)),std::true_type>::value,
6219  "argument to create_async must be a callable object taking zero, one or two arguments");
6220  return ref new details::_AsyncTaskGeneratorThunk<_Function>(_Func, _CAPTURE_CALLSTACK());
6221 }
6222 
6223 #endif /* defined (__cplusplus_winrt) */
6224 
6225 namespace details
6226 {
6227  // Helper struct for when_all operators to know when tasks have completed
6228  template<typename _Type>
6229  struct _RunAllParam
6230  {
6231  _RunAllParam() : _M_completeCount(0), _M_numTasks(0)
6232  {
6233  }
6234 
6235  void _Resize(size_t _Len, bool _SkipVector = false)
6236  {
6237  _M_numTasks = _Len;
6238  if (!_SkipVector)
6239  {
6240  _M_vector._Result.resize(_Len);
6241  }
6242  }
6243 
6244  task_completion_event<_Unit_type> _M_completed;
6245  _ResultHolder<std::vector<_Type> > _M_vector;
6246  _ResultHolder<_Type> _M_mergeVal;
6247  atomic_size_t _M_completeCount;
6248  size_t _M_numTasks;
6249  };
6250 
6251  template<typename _Type>
6252  struct _RunAllParam<std::vector<_Type> >
6253  {
6254  _RunAllParam() : _M_completeCount(0), _M_numTasks(0)
6255  {
6256  }
6257 
6258  void _Resize(size_t _Len, bool _SkipVector = false)
6259  {
6260  _M_numTasks = _Len;
6261 
6262  if (!_SkipVector)
6263  {
6264  _M_vector.resize(_Len);
6265  }
6266  }
6267 
6268  task_completion_event<_Unit_type> _M_completed;
6269  std::vector<_ResultHolder<std::vector<_Type> > > _M_vector;
6270  atomic_size_t _M_completeCount;
6271  size_t _M_numTasks;
6272  };
6273 
6274  // Helper struct specialization for void
6275  template<>
6276  struct _RunAllParam<_Unit_type>
6277  {
6278  _RunAllParam() : _M_completeCount(0), _M_numTasks(0)
6279  {
6280  }
6281 
6282  void _Resize(size_t _Len)
6283  {
6284  _M_numTasks = _Len;
6285  }
6286 
6287  task_completion_event<_Unit_type> _M_completed;
6288  atomic_size_t _M_completeCount;
6289  size_t _M_numTasks;
6290  };
6291 
6292  inline void _JoinAllTokens_Add(const cancellation_token_source& _MergedSrc, _CancellationTokenState *_PJoinedTokenState)
6293  {
6294  if (_PJoinedTokenState != nullptr && _PJoinedTokenState != _CancellationTokenState::_None())
6295  {
6296  cancellation_token _T = cancellation_token::_FromImpl(_PJoinedTokenState);
6297  _T.register_callback( [=](){
6298  _MergedSrc.cancel();
6299  });
6300  }
6301  }
6302 
6303  template<typename _ElementType, typename _Function, typename _TaskType>
6304  void _WhenAllContinuationWrapper(_RunAllParam<_ElementType>* _PParam, _Function _Func, task<_TaskType>& _Task)
6305  {
6306  if (_Task._GetImpl()->_IsCompleted())
6307  {
6308  _Func();
6309  if (atomic_increment(_PParam->_M_completeCount) == _PParam->_M_numTasks)
6310  {
6311  // Inline execute its direct continuation, the _ReturnTask
6312  _PParam->_M_completed.set(_Unit_type());
6313  // It's safe to delete it since all usage of _PParam in _ReturnTask has been finished.
6314  delete _PParam;
6315  }
6316  }
6317  else
6318  {
6319  _ASSERTE(_Task._GetImpl()->_IsCanceled());
6320  if (_Task._GetImpl()->_HasUserException())
6321  {
6322  // _Cancel will return false if the TCE is already canceled with or without exception
6323  _PParam->_M_completed._Cancel(_Task._GetImpl()->_GetExceptionHolder());
6324  }
6325  else
6326  {
6327  _PParam->_M_completed._Cancel();
6328  }
6329 
6330  if (atomic_increment(_PParam->_M_completeCount) == _PParam->_M_numTasks)
6331  {
6332  delete _PParam;
6333  }
6334  }
6335  }
6336 
6337  template<typename _ElementType, typename _Iterator>
6338  struct _WhenAllImpl
6339  {
6340  static task<std::vector<_ElementType>> _Perform(const task_options& _TaskOptions, _Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End)
6341  {
6342  _CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState = _TaskOptions.has_cancellation_token() ? _TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue() : nullptr;
6343 
6344  auto _PParam = new _RunAllParam<_ElementType>();
6345  cancellation_token_source _MergedSource;
6346 
6347  // Step1: Create task completion event.
6348  task_options _Options(_TaskOptions);
6349  _Options.set_cancellation_token(_MergedSource.get_token());
6350  task<_Unit_type> _All_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_completed, _Options);
6351  // The return task must be created before step 3 to enforce inline execution.
6352  auto _ReturnTask = _All_tasks_completed._Then([=](_Unit_type) -> std::vector<_ElementType> {
6353  return _PParam->_M_vector.Get();
6354  }, nullptr);
6355 
6356  // Step2: Combine and check tokens, and count elements in range.
6357  if (_PTokenState)
6358  {
6359  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _PTokenState);
6360  _PParam->_Resize(static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(_Begin, _End)));
6361  }
6362  else
6363  {
6364  size_t _TaskNum = 0;
6365  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6366  {
6367  _TaskNum++;
6368  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _PTask->_GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState);
6369  }
6370  _PParam->_Resize(_TaskNum);
6371  }
6372 
6373  // Step3: Check states of previous tasks.
6374  if( _Begin == _End )
6375  {
6376  _PParam->_M_completed.set(_Unit_type());
6377  delete _PParam;
6378  }
6379  else
6380  {
6381  size_t _Index = 0;
6382  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6383  {
6384  if (_PTask->is_apartment_aware())
6385  {
6386  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
6387  }
6388 
6389  _PTask->_Then([_PParam, _Index](task<_ElementType> _ResultTask) {
6390 
6391  // Dev10 compiler bug
6392  typedef _ElementType _ElementTypeDev10;
6393  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
6394  auto _IndexCopy = _Index;
6395  auto _Func = [_PParamCopy, _IndexCopy, &_ResultTask](){
6396  _PParamCopy->_M_vector._Result[_IndexCopy] = _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult();
6397  };
6398 
6399  _WhenAllContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6400  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6401 
6402  _Index++;
6403  }
6404  }
6405 
6406  return _ReturnTask;
6407  }
6408  };
6409 
6410  template<typename _ElementType, typename _Iterator>
6411  struct _WhenAllImpl<std::vector<_ElementType>, _Iterator>
6412  {
6413  static task<std::vector<_ElementType>> _Perform(const task_options& _TaskOptions, _Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End)
6414  {
6415  _CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState = _TaskOptions.has_cancellation_token() ? _TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue() : nullptr;
6416 
6417  auto _PParam = new _RunAllParam<std::vector<_ElementType>>();
6418  cancellation_token_source _MergedSource;
6419 
6420  // Step1: Create task completion event.
6421  task_options _Options(_TaskOptions);
6422  _Options.set_cancellation_token(_MergedSource.get_token());
6423  task<_Unit_type> _All_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_completed, _Options);
6424  // The return task must be created before step 3 to enforce inline execution.
6425  auto _ReturnTask = _All_tasks_completed._Then([=](_Unit_type) -> std::vector<_ElementType> {
6426  _ASSERTE(_PParam->_M_completeCount == _PParam->_M_numTasks);
6427  std::vector<_ElementType> _Result;
6428  for(size_t _I = 0; _I < _PParam->_M_numTasks; _I++)
6429  {
6430  const std::vector<_ElementType>& _Vec = _PParam->_M_vector[_I].Get();
6431  _Result.insert(_Result.end(), _Vec.begin(), _Vec.end());
6432  }
6433  return _Result;
6434  }, nullptr);
6435 
6436  // Step2: Combine and check tokens, and count elements in range.
6437  if (_PTokenState)
6438  {
6439  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _PTokenState);
6440  _PParam->_Resize(static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(_Begin, _End)));
6441  }
6442  else
6443  {
6444  size_t _TaskNum = 0;
6445  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6446  {
6447  _TaskNum++;
6448  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _PTask->_GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState);
6449  }
6450  _PParam->_Resize(_TaskNum);
6451  }
6452 
6453  // Step3: Check states of previous tasks.
6454  if( _Begin == _End )
6455  {
6456  _PParam->_M_completed.set(_Unit_type());
6457  delete _PParam;
6458  }
6459  else
6460  {
6461  size_t _Index = 0;
6462  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6463  {
6464  if (_PTask->is_apartment_aware())
6465  {
6466  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
6467  }
6468 
6469  _PTask->_Then([_PParam, _Index](task<std::vector<_ElementType>> _ResultTask) {
6470  // Dev10 compiler bug
6471  typedef _ElementType _ElementTypeDev10;
6472  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
6473  auto _IndexCopy = _Index;
6474  auto _Func = [_PParamCopy, _IndexCopy, &_ResultTask]() {
6475  _PParamCopy->_M_vector[_IndexCopy].Set(_ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult());
6476  };
6477 
6478  _WhenAllContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6479  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6480 
6481  _Index++;
6482  }
6483  }
6484 
6485  return _ReturnTask;
6486  }
6487  };
6488 
6489  template<typename _Iterator>
6490  struct _WhenAllImpl<void, _Iterator>
6491  {
6492  static task<void> _Perform(const task_options& _TaskOptions, _Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End)
6493  {
6494  _CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState = _TaskOptions.has_cancellation_token() ? _TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue() : nullptr;
6495 
6496  auto _PParam = new _RunAllParam<_Unit_type>();
6497  cancellation_token_source _MergedSource;
6498 
6499  // Step1: Create task completion event.
6500  task_options _Options(_TaskOptions);
6501  _Options.set_cancellation_token(_MergedSource.get_token());
6502  task<_Unit_type> _All_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_completed, _Options);
6503  // The return task must be created before step 3 to enforce inline execution.
6504  auto _ReturnTask = _All_tasks_completed._Then([=](_Unit_type) {
6505  }, nullptr);
6506 
6507  // Step2: Combine and check tokens, and count elements in range.
6508  if (_PTokenState)
6509  {
6510  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _PTokenState);
6511  _PParam->_Resize(static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(_Begin, _End)));
6512  }
6513  else
6514  {
6515  size_t _TaskNum = 0;
6516  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6517  {
6518  _TaskNum++;
6519  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _PTask->_GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState);
6520  }
6521  _PParam->_Resize(_TaskNum);
6522  }
6523 
6524  // Step3: Check states of previous tasks.
6525  if( _Begin == _End )
6526  {
6527  _PParam->_M_completed.set(_Unit_type());
6528  delete _PParam;
6529  }
6530  else
6531  {
6532  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6533  {
6534  if (_PTask->is_apartment_aware())
6535  {
6536  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
6537  }
6538 
6539  _PTask->_Then([_PParam](task<void> _ResultTask) {
6540  auto _Func = [](){};
6541  _WhenAllContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6542  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6543  }
6544  }
6545 
6546  return _ReturnTask;
6547  }
6548  };
6549 
6550  template<typename _ReturnType>
6551  task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> _WhenAllVectorAndValue(const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>>& _VectorTask, const task<_ReturnType>& _ValueTask,
6552  bool _OutputVectorFirst)
6553  {
6554  auto _PParam = new _RunAllParam<_ReturnType>();
6555  cancellation_token_source _MergedSource;
6556 
6557  // Step1: Create task completion event.
6558  task<_Unit_type> _All_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_completed, _MergedSource.get_token());
6559  // The return task must be created before step 3 to enforce inline execution.
6560  auto _ReturnTask = _All_tasks_completed._Then([=](_Unit_type) -> std::vector<_ReturnType> {
6561  _ASSERTE(_PParam->_M_completeCount == 2);
6562  auto _Result = _PParam->_M_vector.Get(); // copy by value
6563  auto _mergeVal = _PParam->_M_mergeVal.Get();
6564 
6565  if (_OutputVectorFirst == true)
6566  {
6567  _Result.push_back(_mergeVal);
6568  }
6569  else
6570  {
6571  _Result.insert(_Result.begin(), _mergeVal);
6572  }
6573  return _Result;
6574  }, nullptr);
6575 
6576  // Step2: Combine and check tokens.
6577  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _VectorTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState);
6578  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_MergedSource, _ValueTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState);
6579 
6580  // Step3: Check states of previous tasks.
6581  _PParam->_Resize(2, true);
6582 
6583  if (_VectorTask.is_apartment_aware() || _ValueTask.is_apartment_aware())
6584  {
6585  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
6586  }
6587  _VectorTask._Then([_PParam](task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> _ResultTask) {
6588  // Dev10 compiler bug
6589  typedef _ReturnType _ReturnTypeDev10;
6590  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
6591  auto _Func = [_PParamCopy, &_ResultTask]() {
6592  auto _ResultLocal = _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult();
6593  _PParamCopy->_M_vector.Set(_ResultLocal);
6594  };
6595 
6596  _WhenAllContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6597  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6598  _ValueTask._Then([_PParam](task<_ReturnType> _ResultTask) {
6599  // Dev10 compiler bug
6600  typedef _ReturnType _ReturnTypeDev10;
6601  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
6602  auto _Func = [_PParamCopy, &_ResultTask]() {
6603  auto _ResultLocal = _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult();
6604  _PParamCopy->_M_mergeVal.Set(_ResultLocal);
6605  };
6606 
6607  _WhenAllContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6608  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6609 
6610  return _ReturnTask;
6611  }
6612 } // namespace details
6613 
6614 /// <summary>
6615 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when all of the tasks supplied as arguments complete successfully.
6616 /// </summary>
6617 /// <typeparam name="_Iterator">
6618 /// The type of the input iterator.
6619 /// </typeparam>
6620 /// <param name="_Begin">
6621 /// The position of the first element in the range of elements to be combined into the resulting task.
6622 /// </param>
6623 /// <param name="_End">
6624 /// The position of the first element beyond the range of elements to be combined into the resulting task.
6625 /// </param>
6626 /// <returns>
6627 /// A task that completes sucessfully when all of the input tasks have completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
6628 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output
6629 /// task will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
6630 /// </returns>
6631 /// <remarks>
6632 /// If one of the tasks is canceled or throws an exception, the returned task will complete early, in the canceled state, and the exception,
6633 /// if one is encoutered, will be thrown if you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
6634 /// </remarks>
6635 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
6636 /**/
6637 template <typename _Iterator>
6638 auto when_all(_Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End, const task_options& _TaskOptions = task_options())
6639  -> decltype (details::_WhenAllImpl<typename std::iterator_traits<_Iterator>::value_type::result_type, _Iterator>::_Perform(_TaskOptions, _Begin, _End))
6640 {
6641  typedef typename std::iterator_traits<_Iterator>::value_type::result_type _ElementType;
6642  return details::_WhenAllImpl<_ElementType, _Iterator>::_Perform(_TaskOptions, _Begin, _End);
6643 }
6644 
6645 /// <summary>
6646 /// Creates a task that will complete succesfully when both of the tasks supplied as arguments complete successfully.
6647 /// </summary>
6648 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
6649 /// The type of the returned task.
6650 /// </typeparam>
6651 /// <param name="_Lhs">
6652 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
6653 /// </param>
6654 /// <param name="_Rhs">
6655 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
6656 /// </param>
6657 /// <returns>
6658 /// A task that completes successfully when both of the input tasks have completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
6659 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output
6660 /// task will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
6661 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA &amp;&amp; taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, the &amp;&amp; operator
6662 /// produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if either one or both of the tasks are of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>.</para>
6663 /// </returns>
6664 /// <remarks>
6665 /// If one of the tasks is canceled or throws an exception, the returned task will complete early, in the canceled state, and the exception,
6666 /// if one is encoutered, will be thrown if you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
6667 /// </remarks>
6668 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
6669 /**/
6670 template<typename _ReturnType>
6671 task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> operator&&(const task<_ReturnType> & _Lhs, const task<_ReturnType> & _Rhs)
6672 {
6673  task<_ReturnType> _PTasks[2] = {_Lhs, _Rhs};
6674  return when_all(_PTasks, _PTasks+2);
6675 }
6676 
6677 /// <summary>
6678 /// Creates a task that will complete succesfully when both of the tasks supplied as arguments complete successfully.
6679 /// </summary>
6680 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
6681 /// The type of the returned task.
6682 /// </typeparam>
6683 /// <param name="_Lhs">
6684 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
6685 /// </param>
6686 /// <param name="_Rhs">
6687 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
6688 /// </param>
6689 /// <returns>
6690 /// A task that completes successfully when both of the input tasks have completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
6691 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output
6692 /// task will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
6693 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA &amp;&amp; taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, the &amp;&amp; operator
6694 /// produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if either one or both of the tasks are of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>.</para>
6695 /// </returns>
6696 /// <remarks>
6697 /// If one of the tasks is canceled or throws an exception, the returned task will complete early, in the canceled state, and the exception,
6698 /// if one is encoutered, will be thrown if you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
6699 /// </remarks>
6700 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
6701 /**/
6702 template<typename _ReturnType>
6703 task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> operator&&(const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> & _Lhs, const task<_ReturnType> & _Rhs)
6704 {
6705  return details::_WhenAllVectorAndValue(_Lhs, _Rhs, true);
6706 }
6707 
6708 /// <summary>
6709 /// Creates a task that will complete succesfully when both of the tasks supplied as arguments complete successfully.
6710 /// </summary>
6711 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
6712 /// The type of the returned task.
6713 /// </typeparam>
6714 /// <param name="_Lhs">
6715 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
6716 /// </param>
6717 /// <param name="_Rhs">
6718 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
6719 /// </param>
6720 /// <returns>
6721 /// A task that completes successfully when both of the input tasks have completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
6722 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output
6723 /// task will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
6724 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA &amp;&amp; taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, the &amp;&amp; operator
6725 /// produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if either one or both of the tasks are of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>.</para>
6726 /// </returns>
6727 /// <remarks>
6728 /// If one of the tasks is canceled or throws an exception, the returned task will complete early, in the canceled state, and the exception,
6729 /// if one is encoutered, will be thrown if you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
6730 /// </remarks>
6731 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
6732 /**/
6733 template<typename _ReturnType>
6734 task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> operator&&(const task<_ReturnType> & _Lhs, const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> & _Rhs)
6735 {
6736  return details::_WhenAllVectorAndValue(_Rhs, _Lhs, false);
6737 }
6738 
6739 /// <summary>
6740 /// Creates a task that will complete succesfully when both of the tasks supplied as arguments complete successfully.
6741 /// </summary>
6742 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
6743 /// The type of the returned task.
6744 /// </typeparam>
6745 /// <param name="_Lhs">
6746 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
6747 /// </param>
6748 /// <param name="_Rhs">
6749 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
6750 /// </param>
6751 /// <returns>
6752 /// A task that completes successfully when both of the input tasks have completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
6753 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output
6754 /// task will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
6755 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA &amp;&amp; taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, the &amp;&amp; operator
6756 /// produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if either one or both of the tasks are of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>.</para>
6757 /// </returns>
6758 /// <remarks>
6759 /// If one of the tasks is canceled or throws an exception, the returned task will complete early, in the canceled state, and the exception,
6760 /// if one is encoutered, will be thrown if you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
6761 /// </remarks>
6762 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
6763 /**/
6764 template<typename _ReturnType>
6765 task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> operator&&(const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> & _Lhs, const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> & _Rhs)
6766 {
6767  task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> _PTasks[2] = {_Lhs, _Rhs};
6768  return when_all(_PTasks, _PTasks+2);
6769 }
6770 
6771 /// <summary>
6772 /// Creates a task that will complete succesfully when both of the tasks supplied as arguments complete successfully.
6773 /// </summary>
6774 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
6775 /// The type of the returned task.
6776 /// </typeparam>
6777 /// <param name="_Lhs">
6778 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
6779 /// </param>
6780 /// <param name="_Rhs">
6781 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
6782 /// </param>
6783 /// <returns>
6784 /// A task that completes successfully when both of the input tasks have completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
6785 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output
6786 /// task will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
6787 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA &amp;&amp; taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, the &amp;&amp; operator
6788 /// produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if either one or both of the tasks are of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>.</para>
6789 /// </returns>
6790 /// <remarks>
6791 /// If one of the tasks is canceled or throws an exception, the returned task will complete early, in the canceled state, and the exception,
6792 /// if one is encoutered, will be thrown if you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
6793 /// </remarks>
6794 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
6795 /**/
6796 inline task<void> operator&&(const task<void> & _Lhs, const task<void> & _Rhs)
6797 {
6798  task<void> _PTasks[2] = {_Lhs, _Rhs};
6799  return when_all(_PTasks, _PTasks+2);
6800 }
6801 
6802 namespace details
6803 {
6804  // Helper struct for when_any operators to know when tasks have completed
6805  template <typename _CompletionType>
6806  struct _RunAnyParam
6807  {
6808  _RunAnyParam() : _M_exceptionRelatedToken(nullptr), _M_completeCount(0), _M_numTasks(0), _M_fHasExplicitToken(false)
6809  {
6810  }
6811  ~_RunAnyParam()
6812  {
6813  if (_CancellationTokenState::_IsValid(_M_exceptionRelatedToken))
6814  _M_exceptionRelatedToken->_Release();
6815  }
6816  task_completion_event<_CompletionType> _M_Completed;
6817  cancellation_token_source _M_cancellationSource;
6818  _CancellationTokenState * _M_exceptionRelatedToken;
6819  atomic_size_t _M_completeCount;
6820  size_t _M_numTasks;
6821  bool _M_fHasExplicitToken;
6822  };
6823 
6824  template<typename _CompletionType, typename _Function, typename _TaskType>
6825  void _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_RunAnyParam<_CompletionType> * _PParam, const _Function & _Func, task<_TaskType>& _Task)
6826  {
6827  bool _IsTokenCancled = !_PParam->_M_fHasExplicitToken && _Task._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState != _CancellationTokenState::_None() && _Task._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState->_IsCanceled();
6828  if (_Task._GetImpl()->_IsCompleted() && !_IsTokenCancled)
6829  {
6830  _Func();
6831  if (atomic_increment(_PParam->_M_completeCount) == _PParam->_M_numTasks)
6832  {
6833  delete _PParam;
6834  }
6835  }
6836  else
6837  {
6838  _ASSERTE(_Task._GetImpl()->_IsCanceled() || _IsTokenCancled);
6839  if (_Task._GetImpl()->_HasUserException() && !_IsTokenCancled)
6840  {
6841  if (_PParam->_M_Completed._StoreException(_Task._GetImpl()->_GetExceptionHolder()))
6842  {
6843  // This can only enter once.
6844  _PParam->_M_exceptionRelatedToken = _Task._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState;
6845  _ASSERTE(_PParam->_M_exceptionRelatedToken);
6846  // Deref token will be done in the _PParam destructor.
6847  if (_PParam->_M_exceptionRelatedToken != _CancellationTokenState::_None())
6848  {
6849  _PParam->_M_exceptionRelatedToken->_Reference();
6850  }
6851  }
6852  }
6853 
6854  if (atomic_increment(_PParam->_M_completeCount) == _PParam->_M_numTasks)
6855  {
6856  // If no one has be completed so far, we need to make some final cancellation decision.
6857  if (!_PParam->_M_Completed._IsTriggered())
6858  {
6859  // If we already explicit token, we can skip the token join part.
6860  if (!_PParam->_M_fHasExplicitToken)
6861  {
6862  if (_PParam->_M_exceptionRelatedToken)
6863  {
6864  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, _PParam->_M_exceptionRelatedToken);
6865  }
6866  else
6867  {
6868  // If haven't captured any exception token yet, there was no exception for all those tasks,
6869  // so just pick a random token (current one) for normal cancellation.
6870  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, _Task._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState);
6871  }
6872  }
6873  // Do exception cancellation or normal cancellation based on whether it has stored exception.
6874  _PParam->_M_Completed._Cancel();
6875  }
6876  delete _PParam;
6877  }
6878  }
6879  }
6880 
6881  template<typename _ElementType, typename _Iterator>
6882  struct _WhenAnyImpl
6883  {
6884  static task<std::pair<_ElementType, size_t>> _Perform(const task_options& _TaskOptions, _Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End)
6885  {
6886  if( _Begin == _End )
6887  {
6888  throw invalid_operation("when_any(begin, end) cannot be called on an empty container.");
6889  }
6890  _CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState = _TaskOptions.has_cancellation_token() ? _TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue() : nullptr;
6891  auto _PParam = new _RunAnyParam<std::pair<std::pair<_ElementType, size_t>, _CancellationTokenState *>>();
6892 
6893  if (_PTokenState)
6894  {
6895  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, _PTokenState);
6896  _PParam->_M_fHasExplicitToken = true;
6897  }
6898 
6899  task_options _Options(_TaskOptions);
6900  _Options.set_cancellation_token(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource.get_token());
6901  task<std::pair<std::pair<_ElementType, size_t>, _CancellationTokenState *>> _Any_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_Completed, _Options);
6902 
6903  // Keep a copy ref to the token source
6904  auto _CancellationSource = _PParam->_M_cancellationSource;
6905 
6906  _PParam->_M_numTasks = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(_Begin, _End));
6907  size_t _Index = 0;
6908  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6909  {
6910  if (_PTask->is_apartment_aware())
6911  {
6912  _Any_tasks_completed._SetAsync();
6913  }
6914 
6915  _PTask->_Then([_PParam, _Index](task<_ElementType> _ResultTask) {
6916  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam; // Dev10
6917  auto _IndexCopy = _Index; // Dev10
6918  auto _Func = [&_ResultTask, _PParamCopy, _IndexCopy]() {
6919  _PParamCopy->_M_Completed.set(std::make_pair(std::make_pair(_ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult(), _IndexCopy), _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState));
6920  };
6921 
6922  _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6923  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6924 
6925  _Index++;
6926  }
6927 
6928  // All _Any_tasks_completed._SetAsync() must be finished before this return continuation task being created.
6929  return _Any_tasks_completed._Then([=](std::pair<std::pair<_ElementType, size_t>, _CancellationTokenState *> _Result) -> std::pair<_ElementType, size_t> {
6930  _ASSERTE(_Result.second);
6931  if (!_PTokenState)
6932  {
6933  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_CancellationSource, _Result.second);
6934  }
6935  return _Result.first;
6936  }, nullptr);
6937  }
6938  };
6939 
6940  template<typename _Iterator>
6941  struct _WhenAnyImpl<void, _Iterator>
6942  {
6943  static task<size_t> _Perform(const task_options& _TaskOptions, _Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End)
6944  {
6945  if( _Begin == _End )
6946  {
6947  throw invalid_operation("when_any(begin, end) cannot be called on an empty container.");
6948  }
6949 
6950  _CancellationTokenState *_PTokenState = _TaskOptions.has_cancellation_token() ? _TaskOptions.get_cancellation_token()._GetImplValue() : nullptr;
6951  auto _PParam = new _RunAnyParam<std::pair<size_t, _CancellationTokenState *>>();
6952 
6953  if (_PTokenState)
6954  {
6955  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, _PTokenState);
6956  _PParam->_M_fHasExplicitToken = true;
6957  }
6958 
6959  task_options _Options(_TaskOptions);
6960  _Options.set_cancellation_token(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource.get_token());
6961  task<std::pair<size_t, _CancellationTokenState *>> _Any_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_Completed, _Options);
6962 
6963  // Keep a copy ref to the token source
6964  auto _CancellationSource = _PParam->_M_cancellationSource;
6965 
6966  _PParam->_M_numTasks = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(_Begin, _End));
6967  size_t _Index = 0;
6968  for (auto _PTask = _Begin; _PTask != _End; ++_PTask)
6969  {
6970  if (_PTask->is_apartment_aware())
6971  {
6972  _Any_tasks_completed._SetAsync();
6973  }
6974 
6975  _PTask->_Then([_PParam, _Index](task<void> _ResultTask) {
6976  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam; // Dev10
6977  auto _IndexCopy = _Index; // Dev10
6978  auto _Func = [&_ResultTask, _PParamCopy, _IndexCopy]() {
6979  _PParamCopy->_M_Completed.set(std::make_pair(_IndexCopy, _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState));
6980  };
6981  _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
6982  }, _CancellationTokenState::_None());
6983 
6984  _Index++;
6985  }
6986 
6987  // All _Any_tasks_completed._SetAsync() must be finished before this return continuation task being created.
6988  return _Any_tasks_completed._Then([=](std::pair<size_t, _CancellationTokenState *> _Result) -> size_t {
6989  _ASSERTE(_Result.second);
6990  if (!_PTokenState)
6991  {
6992  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_CancellationSource, _Result.second);
6993  }
6994  return _Result.first;
6995  }, nullptr);
6996  }
6997  };
6998 } // namespace details
6999 
7000 /// <summary>
7001 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when any of the tasks supplied as arguments completes successfully.
7002 /// </summary>
7003 /// <typeparam name="_Iterator">
7004 /// The type of the input iterator.
7005 /// </typeparam>
7006 /// <param name="_Begin">
7007 /// The position of the first element in the range of elements to be combined into the resulting task.
7008 /// </param>
7009 /// <param name="_End">
7010 /// The position of the first element beyond the range of elements to be combined into the resulting task.
7011 /// </param>
7012 /// <returns>
7013 /// A task that completes successfully when any one of the input tasks has completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
7014 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::pair&lt;T, size_t&gt;&gt;></c>, where the first element of the pair is the result
7015 /// of the completing task, and the second element is the index of the task that finished. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c>
7016 /// the output is a <c>task&lt;size_t&gt;</c>, where the result is the index of the completing task.
7017 /// </returns>
7018 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
7019 /**/
7020 template<typename _Iterator>
7021 auto when_any(_Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End, const task_options& _TaskOptions = task_options())
7022  -> decltype (details::_WhenAnyImpl<typename std::iterator_traits<_Iterator>::value_type::result_type, _Iterator>::_Perform(_TaskOptions, _Begin, _End))
7023 {
7024  typedef typename std::iterator_traits<_Iterator>::value_type::result_type _ElementType;
7025  return details::_WhenAnyImpl<_ElementType, _Iterator>::_Perform(_TaskOptions, _Begin, _End);
7026 }
7027 
7028 /// <summary>
7029 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when any of the tasks supplied as arguments completes successfully.
7030 /// </summary>
7031 /// <typeparam name="_Iterator">
7032 /// The type of the input iterator.
7033 /// </typeparam>
7034 /// <param name="_Begin">
7035 /// The position of the first element in the range of elements to be combined into the resulting task.
7036 /// </param>
7037 /// <param name="_End">
7038 /// The position of the first element beyond the range of elements to be combined into the resulting task.
7039 /// </param>
7040 /// <param name="_CancellationToken">
7041 /// The cancellation token which controls cancellation of the returned task. If you do not provide a cancellation token, the resulting
7042 /// task will receive the cancellation token of the task that causes it to complete.
7043 /// </param>
7044 /// <returns>
7045 /// A task that completes successfully when any one of the input tasks has completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
7046 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::pair&lt;T, size_t&gt;&gt;></c>, where the first element of the pair is the result
7047 /// of the completing task, and the second element is the index of the task that finished. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c>
7048 /// the output is a <c>task&lt;size_t&gt;</c>, where the result is the index of the completing task.
7049 /// </returns>
7050 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
7051 /**/
7052 template<typename _Iterator>
7053 auto when_any(_Iterator _Begin, _Iterator _End, cancellation_token _CancellationToken)
7054  -> decltype (details::_WhenAnyImpl<typename std::iterator_traits<_Iterator>::value_type::result_type, _Iterator>::_Perform(_CancellationToken._GetImplValue(), _Begin, _End))
7055 {
7056  typedef typename std::iterator_traits<_Iterator>::value_type::result_type _ElementType;
7057  return details::_WhenAnyImpl<_ElementType, _Iterator>::_Perform(_CancellationToken._GetImplValue(), _Begin, _End);
7058 }
7059 
7060 /// <summary>
7061 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when either of the tasks supplied as arguments completes successfully.
7062 /// </summary>
7063 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
7064 /// The type of the returned task.
7065 /// </typeparam>
7066 /// <param name="_Lhs">
7067 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
7068 /// </param>
7069 /// <param name="_Rhs">
7070 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
7071 /// </param>
7072 /// <returns>
7073 /// A task that completes sucessfully when either of the input tasks has completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
7074 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output task
7075 /// will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
7076 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA || taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, with &amp;&amp; taking precedence
7077 /// over ||, the operator|| produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if one of the tasks is of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>
7078 /// and the other one is of type <c>task&lt;T&gt;.</c></para>
7079 /// </returns>
7080 /// <remarks>
7081 /// If both of the tasks are canceled or throw exceptions, the returned task will complete in the canceled state, and one of the exceptions,
7082 /// if any are encountered, will be thrown when you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
7083 /// </remarks>
7084 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
7085 /**/
7086 template<typename _ReturnType>
7087 task<_ReturnType> operator||(const task<_ReturnType> & _Lhs, const task<_ReturnType> & _Rhs)
7088 {
7089  auto _PParam = new details::_RunAnyParam<std::pair<_ReturnType, size_t>>();
7090 
7091  task<std::pair<_ReturnType, size_t>> _Any_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_Completed, _PParam->_M_cancellationSource.get_token());
7092  // Chain the return continuation task here to ensure it will get inline execution when _M_Completed.set is called,
7093  // So that _PParam can be used before it getting deleted.
7094  auto _ReturnTask = _Any_tasks_completed._Then([=](std::pair<_ReturnType, size_t> _Ret) -> _ReturnType {
7095  _ASSERTE(_Ret.second);
7096  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, reinterpret_cast<details::_CancellationTokenState *>(_Ret.second));
7097  return _Ret.first;
7098  }, nullptr);
7099 
7100  if (_Lhs.is_apartment_aware() || _Rhs.is_apartment_aware())
7101  {
7102  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
7103  }
7104 
7105  _PParam->_M_numTasks = 2;
7106  auto _Continuation = [_PParam](task<_ReturnType> _ResultTask) {
7107  // Dev10 compiler bug
7108  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
7109  auto _Func = [&_ResultTask, _PParamCopy]() {
7110  _PParamCopy->_M_Completed.set(std::make_pair(_ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult(), reinterpret_cast<size_t>(_ResultTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState)));
7111  };
7112  _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
7113  };
7114 
7115  _Lhs._Then(_Continuation, details::_CancellationTokenState::_None());
7116  _Rhs._Then(_Continuation, details::_CancellationTokenState::_None());
7117 
7118  return _ReturnTask;
7119 }
7120 
7121 /// <summary>
7122 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when any of the tasks supplied as arguments completes successfully.
7123 /// </summary>
7124 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
7125 /// The type of the returned task.
7126 /// </typeparam>
7127 /// <param name="_Lhs">
7128 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
7129 /// </param>
7130 /// <param name="_Rhs">
7131 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
7132 /// </param>
7133 /// <returns>
7134 /// A task that completes sucessfully when either of the input tasks has completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
7135 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output task
7136 /// will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
7137 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA || taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, with &amp;&amp; taking precedence
7138 /// over ||, the operator|| produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if one of the tasks is of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>
7139 /// and the other one is of type <c>task&lt;T&gt;.</c></para>
7140 /// </returns>
7141 /// <remarks>
7142 /// If both of the tasks are canceled or throw exceptions, the returned task will complete in the canceled state, and one of the exceptions,
7143 /// if any are encountered, will be thrown when you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
7144 /// </remarks>
7145 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
7146 /**/
7147 template<typename _ReturnType>
7148 task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> operator||(const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> & _Lhs, const task<_ReturnType> & _Rhs)
7149 {
7150  auto _PParam = new details::_RunAnyParam<std::pair<std::vector<_ReturnType>, details::_CancellationTokenState *>>();
7151 
7152  task<std::pair<std::vector<_ReturnType>, details::_CancellationTokenState *>> _Any_tasks_completed(_PParam->_M_Completed, _PParam->_M_cancellationSource.get_token());
7153 
7154  // Chain the return continuation task here to ensure it will get inline execution when _M_Completed.set is called,
7155  // So that _PParam can be used before it getting deleted.
7156  auto _ReturnTask = _Any_tasks_completed._Then([=](std::pair<std::vector<_ReturnType>, details::_CancellationTokenState *> _Ret) -> std::vector<_ReturnType> {
7157  _ASSERTE(_Ret.second);
7158  _JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, _Ret.second);
7159  return _Ret.first;
7160  }, nullptr);
7161 
7162  if (_Lhs.is_apartment_aware() || _Rhs.is_apartment_aware())
7163  {
7164  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
7165  }
7166 
7167  _PParam->_M_numTasks = 2;
7168  _Lhs._Then([_PParam](task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> _ResultTask) {
7169  // Dev10 compiler bug
7170  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
7171  auto _Func = [&_ResultTask, _PParamCopy]() {
7172  auto _Result = _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult();
7173  _PParamCopy->_M_Completed.set(std::make_pair(_Result, _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState));
7174  };
7175  _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
7176  }, details::_CancellationTokenState::_None());
7177 
7178 
7179  _Rhs._Then([_PParam](task<_ReturnType> _ResultTask)
7180  {
7181  // Dev10 compiler bug
7182  typedef _ReturnType _ReturnTypeDev10;
7183  auto _PParamCopy = _PParam;
7184  auto _Func = [&_ResultTask, _PParamCopy]() {
7185  auto _Result = _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_GetResult();
7186 
7187  std::vector<_ReturnTypeDev10> _Vec;
7188  _Vec.push_back(_Result);
7189  _PParamCopy->_M_Completed.set(std::make_pair(_Vec, _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState));
7190  };
7191  _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
7192  }, details::_CancellationTokenState::_None());
7193 
7194  return _ReturnTask;
7195 }
7196 
7197 /// <summary>
7198 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when any of the tasks supplied as arguments completes successfully.
7199 /// </summary>
7200 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
7201 /// The type of the returned task.
7202 /// </typeparam>
7203 /// <param name="_Lhs">
7204 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
7205 /// </param>
7206 /// <param name="_Rhs">
7207 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
7208 /// </param>
7209 /// <returns>
7210 /// A task that completes sucessfully when either of the input tasks has completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
7211 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output task
7212 /// will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
7213 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA || taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, with &amp;&amp; taking precedence
7214 /// over ||, the operator|| produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if one of the tasks is of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>
7215 /// and the other one is of type <c>task&lt;T&gt;.</c></para>
7216 /// </returns>
7217 /// <remarks>
7218 /// If both of the tasks are canceled or throw exceptions, the returned task will complete in the canceled state, and one of the exceptions,
7219 /// if any are encountered, will be thrown when you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
7220 /// </remarks>
7221 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
7222 /**/
7223 template<typename _ReturnType>
7224 task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> operator||(const task<_ReturnType> & _Lhs, const task<std::vector<_ReturnType>> & _Rhs)
7225 {
7226  return _Rhs || _Lhs;
7227 }
7228 
7229 /// <summary>
7230 /// Creates a task that will complete successfully when any of the tasks supplied as arguments completes successfully.
7231 /// </summary>
7232 /// <typeparam name="_ReturnType">
7233 /// The type of the returned task.
7234 /// </typeparam>
7235 /// <param name="_Lhs">
7236 /// The first task to combine into the resulting task.
7237 /// </param>
7238 /// <param name="_Rhs">
7239 /// The second task to combine into the resulting task.
7240 /// </param>
7241 /// <returns>
7242 /// A task that completes sucessfully when either of the input tasks has completed successfully. If the input tasks are of type <c>T</c>,
7243 /// the output of this function will be a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;</c>. If the input tasks are of type <c>void</c> the output task
7244 /// will also be a <c>task&lt;void&gt;</c>.
7245 /// <para> To allow for a construct of the sort taskA || taskB &amp;&amp; taskC, which are combined in pairs, with &amp;&amp; taking precedence
7246 /// over ||, the operator|| produces a <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c> if one of the tasks is of type <c>task&lt;std::vector&lt;T&gt;&gt;</c>
7247 /// and the other one is of type <c>task&lt;T&gt;.</c></para>
7248 /// </returns>
7249 /// <remarks>
7250 /// If both of the tasks are canceled or throw exceptions, the returned task will complete in the canceled state, and one of the exceptions,
7251 /// if any are encountered, will be thrown when you call <c>get()</c> or <c>wait()</c> on that task.
7252 /// </remarks>
7253 /// <seealso cref="Task Parallelism (Concurrency Runtime)"/>
7254 /**/
7255 inline task<void> operator||(const task<void> & _Lhs, const task<void> & _Rhs)
7256 {
7257  auto _PParam = new details::_RunAnyParam<std::pair<details::_Unit_type, details::_CancellationTokenState *>>();
7258 
7259  task<std::pair<details::_Unit_type, details::_CancellationTokenState *>> _Any_task_completed(_PParam->_M_Completed, _PParam->_M_cancellationSource.get_token());
7260  // Chain the return continuation task here to ensure it will get inline execution when _M_Completed.set is called,
7261  // So that _PParam can be used before it getting deleted.
7262  auto _ReturnTask = _Any_task_completed._Then([=](std::pair<details::_Unit_type, details::_CancellationTokenState *> _Ret) {
7263  _ASSERTE(_Ret.second);
7264  details::_JoinAllTokens_Add(_PParam->_M_cancellationSource, _Ret.second);
7265  }, nullptr);
7266 
7267  if (_Lhs.is_apartment_aware() || _Rhs.is_apartment_aware())
7268  {
7269  _ReturnTask._SetAsync();
7270  }
7271 
7272  _PParam->_M_numTasks = 2;
7273  auto _Continuation = [_PParam](task<void> _ResultTask) mutable {
7274  // Dev10 compiler needs this.
7275  auto _PParam1 = _PParam;
7276  auto _Func = [&_ResultTask, _PParam1]() {
7277  _PParam1->_M_Completed.set(std::make_pair(details::_Unit_type(), _ResultTask._GetImpl()->_M_pTokenState));
7278  };
7279  _WhenAnyContinuationWrapper(_PParam, _Func, _ResultTask);
7280  };
7281 
7282  _Lhs._Then(_Continuation, details::_CancellationTokenState::_None());
7283  _Rhs._Then(_Continuation, details::_CancellationTokenState::_None());
7284 
7285  return _ReturnTask;
7286 }
7287 
7288 template<typename _Ty>
7289 task<_Ty> task_from_result(_Ty _Param, const task_options& _TaskOptions = task_options())
7290 {
7291  task_completion_event<_Ty> _Tce;
7292  _Tce.set(_Param);
7293  return create_task(_Tce, _TaskOptions);
7294 }
7295 
7296 // Work around VS 2010 compiler bug
7297 #if _MSC_VER == 1600
7298 inline task<bool> task_from_result(bool _Param)
7299 {
7300  task_completion_event<bool> _Tce;
7301  _Tce.set(_Param);
7302  return create_task(_Tce, task_options());
7303 }
7304 #endif
7305 inline task<void> task_from_result(const task_options& _TaskOptions = task_options())
7306 {
7307  task_completion_event<void> _Tce;
7308  _Tce.set();
7309  return create_task(_Tce, _TaskOptions);
7310 }
7311 
7312 template<typename _TaskType, typename _ExType>
7313 task<_TaskType> task_from_exception(_ExType _Exception, const task_options& _TaskOptions = task_options())
7314 {
7315  task_completion_event<_TaskType> _Tce;
7316  _Tce.set_exception(_Exception);
7317  return create_task(_Tce, _TaskOptions);
7318 }
7319 
7320 namespace details
7321 {
7322  /// <summary>
7323  /// A convenient extension to Concurrency: loop until a condition is no longer met
7324  /// </summary>
7325  /// <param name="func">
7326  /// A function representing the body of the loop. It will be invoked at least once and
7327  /// then repetitively as long as it returns true.
7328  /// </param>
7329  inline
7330  task<bool> do_while(std::function<task<bool>(void)> func)
7331  {
7332  task<bool> first = func();
7333  return first.then([=](bool guard) -> task<bool> {
7334  if (guard)
7335  return do_while(func);
7336  else
7337  return first;
7338  });
7339  }
7340 
7341 } // namespace details
7342 
7343 } // namespace Concurrency
7344 
7345 #pragma pop_macro("new")
7346 
7347 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
7348 #pragma warning(pop)
7349 #endif
7350 #pragma pack(pop)
7351 
7352 #endif // (defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1800))
7353 
7354 #ifndef _CONCRT_H
7355 #ifndef _LWRCASE_CNCRRNCY
7356 #define _LWRCASE_CNCRRNCY
7357 // Note to reader: we're using lower-case namespace names everywhere, but the 'Concurrency' namespace
7358 // is capitalized for historical reasons. The alias let's us pretend that style issue doesn't exist.
7359 namespace Concurrency {}
7360 namespace concurrency = Concurrency;
7361 #endif
7362 #endif
7363 
7364 #endif // _PPLXTASKS_H
